text: 33 cl. bottled 19/05/2015. Deep brown-black with a disc of fine beady bubbles. Nose is toffee, chocolate, earthy soy, toasted walnut and whiskey. Flavor is vanilla, chocolate, whiskey, toasted peanut and wood. Medium-heavy body has smooth near-medium carbonation and a good balance given the dessert slant provided by the big malts. ABV shows a bit even after 2 years of bottle aging, but not overly so.

Bottled 17-11-14. Thanks to wombat23. Pours dark brown from the bottle and leaves a thin, tan head that soon fades. Aroma is a non-traditional mix of soy sauce, cherry cough drop, light chocolate. Taste is bittersweet, turning dryer and slightly bitterer and a touch salty in the finish. A crazy mix of flavors - cherry, aniseed, soy sauce, Apfelschnaps. Body is medium rather than full, with a very soft carbonation. Finishes warm, but the alcohol remains hidden. Overall a unique beer. While it sometimes threatened to taste more like a medicine than a beer, it never actually took that last step. Absolutely deadly in quantity. Creative, interesting, great!

Shared 33cl bottle. Bottled 5/4/2012. Pours dark brown with a beige head. Aroma of roasted malt and dark fruits. Taste is roasted malt, dark fruits, a bit of smoke, soy sauce, ash, oak, earth. Perhaps some oxidation. Finish is sweet, malty, and alcohol-laden. Somewhat disappointing.

Aroma: sweet and malty with a little smoky; Appearance: pitch black with thin off white head that lingers; Taste: follows nose with unpleasant bitter, burned taste; Palate: heavy body with long, bitter finish; Overall: disappointing.

Bottle:
Basically black, with a thin beige head.
Rich chocolate/fudge, roasty, hay aroma.
Flavour is mildly bitter chocolate malt, vanilla, grass/hay.
Very rich.....a little alcohol warmth, but less than expected.
Very nice.

kolor: Czarny
Aromat: lekka kawa, ciemne słody czekoloadowe, 
Smak: Wytrawne, gorzka czekolada, mocna kawa espresso, paloność duża, fajnie ułożone, przyjemnie sie pije, bardzo dobre piwo, alkohol prawie niewyczuwalny

Aromas pretty good with roast, coffee dark malt and coffee. Flavors like nose, has low carbonation so the Tang from that is minimized. Also has Licorice and Im not a huge fan of that in beer. Still its pretty good stuff. Label says its cellarable for up to 25 years and Id be curious to know what one of those would be like.

Czarne, nieprzejrzyste. Piana beżowa, przechodząca w brąz, drobna, średnio-obfita, zostawia lekki lacing. W zapachu niestety trochę alkoholowo, trochę czekolady, kawa. W smaku wyraźna kawa, do tego gorzka czekolada, paloność, trochę wytrawnie, chlebowo. Wysycenie niskie, goryczka niska, posmak kawowy.

Piłem warkę dość swieżą, a i tak bardzo mnie urzekło. Mocno palone, ale też lekko chlebowe i słodkie, treściwe piwo z super balansem między goryczą, słodkością a palonością. W smaku czuć rodzynki, palony chleb, trochę czekolady, nie czuć za to alkoholu. Czuć było lekkie nuty umami, ale nie przeszkadzały, a wręcz przeciwnie. Godne polecenia każdemu.
Sample on tap at True Bearing Alehouse, Xiamen. Pours red brown with a minimal head. Aroma of chocolate and some vanilla with malt. Intense sweetish finish.
Hasnt got very interesting smell, but taste is very pleasant. Milky sweet with a pineapple aftertaste.

Qui dit de Molen, dit bière de qualité. Cette Tsarina Esra ne fait pas exception tant le travail sur le malt est exceptionnel pour une Imperial Porter sur la douceur avec un sucre bien présent qui en cache ses 11 % Abv et ses 93 dEBU. Malheureusement, celle-ci pêche par une effervescence très peu marquée pour un plaisir forcément atténué. Certains pourront être également décontenancés par une bière où tout est poussé quasi à lextrême, malt, alcool, sucre et amertume. Il ny a que peu de brasserie capable de tenir un équilibre ténu, et De Molen en fait parti. En verre cette incroyable bièreest dun noir total (EBC de 395), quasiment sans effervescence et donc sans aucune mousse à sa surface. Le nez, de façon déconcertante nest pas très intense, même sil présente une complexité intéressante alliant pruneaux, café, réglisse à des notes épicées et fraîche provenant du houblon. Lattaque, par contre, se porte demblée sur une intensité gustative très élevée avec une très belle alliance malt/houblon et des arômes principalement tournés vers le caramel et le chocolat,subtilement épicé (expression du Premiant, en complément du Sladek, plus doux). La deuxième bouche se tourne davantage sur le malt torréfié et des arômes de chocolat plus marqués auxquels viennent sajouter des notes fumées appréciables. Larrière bouche, sur le pruneau et la réglisse présente une amertume plus marquée. La corpulence est quant à elle excellente aidée notamment pas un sucre très présent, couvrant totalement lalcool à de 11 % Abv et lamertume, avec un ressenti moindre que les 93 dEBU affichés. Ainsi lamertume prenant place en troisième bouche nest pas saillante, mais plutôt en rondeur sur des notes épicées. On soriente alors sur un final, long, présentant des arômes de café aux accents épicées. Une bière donc incroyable, sur des expressions à la mesure de sa démesure.

Likier czekoladowy, czekolada, dość słodki aromat, trochę ciemnego pieczywa ze śliwką, czekoladki wiśniowe z alkoholem, subtelne suszone owoce, muśnięcie również suszonej moreli. W smaku jest słodycz, taka lekko owocowa, suszony posmak i trochę paloności. Nisko-średnio wysycone, dość pijalne jak na 11% alk., lekko likierowe, ale nie jest gęste. Susz zalega przez chwilę na języku.

33cl bottle at home. Appearance: pitch black with minimal eggshell white head. Aroma: coffee, caramel, chocolate, some smoke, dark fruits, soy sauce, sirup. Taste: high sweetness and fairly high bitterness. Notes of coffee, chocolate, sirup, 
raisins, red fruits. Palate: above medium bodied, oily texture and medium carbonation

Aroma - very strong of roasted malt with alcohol, a lot of slightly smoked black fruits with alcohol, dark chocolate, very concentrated black fruits jam, a bit of vanilla and slightly burnt fruit wood. Taste - strongly of a burnt malt, old ground coffee, a bit of dark chocolate diluted with cognac/rum, slightly smoked dried black fruits, concentrated syrup of brown sugar. Very good!
Kolor ciemnobrązowy. W aromacie suszone owoce, brzoskwinie, morele. W smaku owoce, brzoskwinie, morele, rodzynki.

Aromat niezbyt silny ale bogaty, przyjemny,są wiśnie i śliwki w likierze,jest kawa i czekolada. Nieprzejrzyste, ciemnobrunatne, niewielka pianka, ale jest. Smak to czekolada, lekka czekoladowa kwaskowatość, pralinki, słodycz kontrowana lekką goryczką kawową i paloną, która nie jest nieprzyjemna i nie zalega zbyt długo,sporo wiśni i trochę wiśniowej cierpkości. Jak na parametry dosyć gładkie i pijalne. Bardzo smaczne
Butelka 0,33l. Aromat owocowy, brzoskwiniowy. W smaku podobnie, bardzo owocowo, brzoskwinie, morele, przyjemnie.

Aroma: malt, caramel, plums, coffee. 
Taste: nice mix of fruits and malt sweetened by caramel. Intensively bitter. Great brew

Geslaagde imperial porter. Niet alleen koffie en toast komen naar voren, maar ook rozijnen, krenten, pruimedanten en kandij. Krachtig aroma en een weinig schuim.

In de geur iets bitter en zuur. Het bitter in de smaak is niet zozeer door de typische geroosterde tonen, maar door de hop (denk ik). Mooi uitgebalanceerd mondgevoel, drinkt makkelijk. Afdronk is complexer dan de smaak.

On tap at Smith Street Taps, Singapore on 15-Feb-2017. Dark brown, almost black in colour with a small beige coloured head. Aroma of coffee, cocao nibs and pine. Full body and soft carbonation. Taste is medium sweet. Dark chocolate, malt, coffee and light bitterness. Creamy bittersweet finish.
The beer has got a deep black colour with a small head and smooth body. Aroma of malt and woods. Taste of malt, plums, woods, dark bread, barrel and campfire. Smooth finish.
Bottle, batch from 27.10.2016. Nice brown head, decent lacing. Quite much alcohol, also roasted malt. Lacks complexity. Full body. Not very interesting.
En fin porter. Ikke meget humle I men god dyb smag og en smule alkohol i den fra whisky.
Bottle. Chocolate fudge, coffee, malt, and hay aroma. Black with minimal head. Very sweet chocolate malt, yeast, and moderately bitter hay flavor. Good body. Okay - pretty straight forward.

Bottle @ Wordenskjolds. Appearance: clear dark brown with ok beige soapy head and lacing. aroma/taste: chocolate, dark fruits, coffee, light pine, alcohol, and some yeasty spicy notes. palette: strong somewhat roasted malty and yeasty aroma, medium carbonation, medium to full body, notable sweetness, balanced by an notable bitterness, long duration and a watery texture. Overall - tasteful and hoppy imp porter.

Bottle from Brew Bristol.
Medium dark head, very dark brown colour, clear.
Aroma: biscuits, vanilla, chocolate.
Lightly sweet with a tiny bit of salty aftertaste.
Full body, long finish, flat.
Very nicely balanced, drinkable.

Tap. Pours black with small fading tan head. Aroma is roasted malt, smoked, complex with tar and coffee notes. Taste is roasted and complex with smoke and liquorice and coffee hints. That classic de Molen balance is just right! Finish has lots of aftertaste and is complex and moderately bitter.

Kolor: Czarny, nieprzejrzyste.
Piana: Nie chce się tworzyć, wymuszona opada do zera. 
Zapach: Miód, smażony ser, sos sojowy, piwnica.
Smak: Umiarkowanie słodkie, dość płaskie. Miód, czekolada, lukrecja. Goryczka średnio intensywna, palona. 
Wysycenie: Niskie, OK.
Opakowanie: Klasyczna etykieta, niedokładny skład.
Uwagi: Warka 17.11.2014 (do 2039) Smaczne ale nie zachwyca. Kojarzy mi się z barleywine z tego browaru przez charakterystyczną nutkę smażonego sera która tam też się pojawiała. Ani to RIS ani Bałtyk.
Roasted notes, meat, leather, practically black with a thin tan head not very persistant, medium/full body, flat, smoked notes, dark fruits and roasted malts...very good this time for de Molen.

Bardzo ładnie wygląda Tsarina Esra. Piwo jest ciemnobrunatne, w szkle wręcz czarne, przy tym nieprzejrzyste. Piana jest beżowa, zbudowana z drobnych oczek, kremowa, długo się utrzymująca, ładnie zdobiąca ścianki szkła piękną koronką i pozostawiającą kożuszek na powierzchni. W aromacie pierwsze skrzypce gra kawa i gorzka czekolada, trufle, praliny czekoladowe, lekka nutka alkoholu, ale raczej szlachetnego, przyjemnego, coś jakby likierowa. Gdzieś w tle kręci się także nutka śliwkowa. Bardzo dobrze, choć jak dla mnie bez "efektu wow!". W smaku jednak ten efekt już jak najbardziej występuje! Od razu zwraca uwagę wyraźna paloność połączona z potężną czekoladowością, która objawia się mocą gorzkiej czekolady, która to dominuje to piwo. Jest bardzo słodko, przy tym nie ulepkowato. Na finiszu wjeżdża wyraźna, wysoka palono-ziołowa goryczka, która sprawia, że chce się brać kolejne łyki, przez co Tsarina Esra jest ekstremalnie pijalna jak na swe parametry. Alkohol, którego jest ponad 10%, jest bardzo dobrze ukryty, czuć go jedynie po lekkim rozgrzewaniu w przełyku. Niskie wysycenie przypomina o tym, że to jednak piwo degustacyjne, mimo że tak lekko wchodzi. Bardzo dobre piwo, De Molen znany z tego, że wie jak się zabrać za mocne piwa, pokazuje klasę i mimo, że piwo jest zaledwie 3 miesiące po rozlewie i ma jeszcze... 25 lat do upływu terminu ważności, to jest idealne do picia już teraz, zdecydowanie nie potrzebuje leżakowania.
From bottle at home. With a huge aroma, rich creamy taste and perfectly concealed alcohol, this imperial porter is one of the best balanced beers out there!

UPDATED: JAN 14, 2017 Zwart bier met stabiele mokkakleurige schuimkraag die redelijk snel inzakt. Mooi aroma en smaken van chocolade, nootjes, donker fruit, appeltjes, (rum)rozijntjes. Zeer zacht in de mond. Perfect in balans. Licht alcoholisch in de afdronk. Beetje tinteling op het tandvlees. Echt wel top deze !!

Imbottigliata il 1° dicembre 2015, aperta l11 gennaio 2017, 10,1% ABV.
Color caramello, limpida con riflessi oro antico, schiuma beige a bolla molto grande ma praticamente inesistente.
Aroma di toffe, cioccolato, uva passa, prugna secca, frutta oltre maturazione, note di amarena, di legno e di ossidazione.
Al palato attacca dolce, sembra barricata, ricorda il bourbon, caramello, metallica, uva passa, finale amaro con caffè, cioccolato, leggerissimo pane nero, leggero erbaceo, prugna secca, con una nota di ossidazione e lieve diacetile.
Retrolfatto di legno secco.
Texture acquosa, carbonazione molto bassa, boozy, corpo pieno.

Bottle, five years after bottling. Pours pitch black, with a creamy, mocha head. Aroma is roasted malts, with bread, coffee, as well as cocoa, leather and wood. Medium to full body, with soft carbonation. Flavour is burned malts, with bread, coffee and cocoa, as well as muscovado, leather and wooden barrels. Lingering bitterness and burned malts in the finish.

330mL bottle from International Beer Collector. Bottled 19/05/15, BB 19/05/40!!!
Pours an immaculate pitch black body with a creamy tan head.
 Aroma subtle at first, but promise is there - 70%+ dark chocolate, burnt sugar, raisins, sweet coffee, blueberrry & other vinous black fruits.
Inky, syrupy, slick body, restrained carbonation with tremendous persistence.
Intense flavours - bitter chocolate, wood, dark berries & currants, black coffee, charred crust, charcoal. Bitterness is strong, lingering warming finish.
Very roasty, unlike anything Ive come across - very impressive.
Tap Black colour with small beige head.Aroma is sweet of roasted coffee and plums also flavors of chocolate and sweet caramel,nice smooth with good full body and good strong finish.
Отличны& имперск& портер, приятны& аромат и очень мощный, плотный насыщен& вкус, продолж& послевк& с горечью. Алкогол& вообще не чувству& очень удивите& Годен до 08.02.2041. (Bottle 0,33/ 10,1%)

On tap, batch #2658. The one Im having is indicated 10.1% ABV ! Pale and large foamy head. Its color is very dark brown, almost black. I smelled chocolate, a bit of coffe too and a little bit of alcool. The taste is really good ; pretty sweet buta balanced. Chocolate and vanilla dominate, with a slight touch of coffe too. A very nice imperial porter (would have say Imp Stout if I had it blind ^^)

Clean nuances of butter cookies, chocolate, plum, some coffee and slightly roasted , bit waxy malts. Balanced with wide taste spectrum and medium aftertaste with chocolate butter cookies. Medium/strong body with medium carbonation.
Backlog, ocena przepisana z untappd, w ramach uzupełniania profilu na ratebeer.

Being chuck norisd in the face by malt, followed by a fist of of chocolate.
Sweet, portary. mouthfeel of honey. 1 bottle feels like more but will 10/1 be too much. fantastic beer.

0.33 l bottle from Bierkompass, bottled in April 2014. Pitch black, no head, just a thin, soapy, beige layer. Sweetish-malty, slightly roasty aroma of chocolate, cold coffee, lots of licorice, some tobacco and slight hints of leather. Moderately sweet, malty, slightly roasty taste of chocolate, coffee, loads of licorice, hazelnut, vanilla and some tobacco, followed by a medium long moderately roasty-bitter finish, absolutely no alcohol detectable. Medium to full body, creamy to oily mouthfeel, almost flat. Tasty sipper, already too flat though. Balance is great, could actually be a bit more expressive, but maybe this was better when it was fresh. Slight disappointment.

UPDATED: NOV 19, 2016 Dark fruit, chocolate, derp malt and alcohol on the nose. Flavor had plum and cherry, dark cocoa. Light to moderate bitterness. Fairly thick but highly carbonated. 
Bottle from craftshack I think.

Marrom/vinho escuro, turva, espuma marrom clara de média formação e persistência de aspecto cremoso. Aroma complexo variando entre uva passa, cereja, amora, chocolate, malte caramelado... Álcool começa aparecer pouco tempo depois de servir. Paladar trás um dulçor médio, leve amargor torrado e uma levíssima acidez que remete a madeira verde. Corpo licoroso e baixa carbonatação. Final de longa persistência intensifica o chocolate e café, rapadura, perde um pouco da complexidade inicial frutado do aroma, um pouco seca, mas ainda assim muito boa.

Bottle. Fantastic, sweet malty aroma with plums and milk chocolate. Totally black with low beigeg head, which quickly reduces to a ring. Taste- again strong, but not tiring malty sweetness, which is well balanced by medium roastyness at the end. You wont mistake this Imperial Porter for a RIS. Full bodied, with pleasant sweet-plummy aftertaste. Top class beer.
Pours dark with almost no head. Aroma of coffee and fruits. Taste: medium sweetness, lightly bitter. low carbonation. Bitter finish.

Poured into a snifter, the appearance was a thick black color with no head nor lacing.
The aroma starts off with thick sweet milk and dark chocolate, full and sweet with a nice deep roasty robust coffee bean rolling on into the blend.
The flavor takes all of those previously mentioned aromas and adds some black licorice. Semi-sticky sort of sweet and roasty aftertaste with a sly sticky finish.
On the palate, this one sat about a light to medium on the body with a really nice smooth roasty to sweet feel rolling over my tongue. Roasty harshness seems to hit nicely.
Overall, really nice Imperial porter that I would have again.

This bottled brew from a bottle shop poured a very small sized head of foamy finely sized brown colored bubbles that were very quickly diminishing and left behind an opaque dark black brown colored body body with no visible carbonation and a poor lacing. The mild aroma was a vinous brown malt. The mouth feel was tingly at the start and at the finish with a lingering roasted malt aftertaste. Delicious and one Id really like to have again.

Flesje @ brouwersplaats Venlo. Bijna zwart van kleur, flink inschenken dan krijg je nog redelijk wat kraag. Ruikt naar pure chocolade en vaag port. Smaak is ook wat portigs, vrij zoet, mokka. Mokka nasmaak. Niet erg complex en het mondgevoel had wat voller mogen zijn.

Kolor intensywnie czarny, piana skromna. W zapachu najsmakowitsze praliny świata, aż cieknie ślinka. Dodatkowo śliwka i karmel. Te same akcenty w smaku, uzupełnionym przez przyjemny posmak goryczki i grzanie w przełyku. Rarytas.

Poured with virtually no head. Nice sweet and alcohol fueled aroma. Taste is strong, sweet and very smooth, going down unusually easily for such a strong intensely tasting beer. I could not taste any bitterness at all, except for perhaps very very slight at the end. Another triumph by the magicians that are De Molen!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
From Zombier. In Teku glass. Watching Los Soprano 4x09. Deliciously sweet. Very low on carbonation, providing it a light and very drinkable feel that is very dangerous for such a ABV

Bottle at 10.1 ABV. Deep brown to black, opaque. Aroma: roasted & peated malts, coffee, earth, fruit esters. Very smooth medium to full oily palate. Semi-sweet. Vinous. Prune, dried cherry. Roast not obvious now. So is the peat. Light bitterness. You fell in love with it slowly with every new sip.-- rated with beerbasher/winphone
Pours an extremely dark brown with a short, light tan head. Humble notes of chocolate roasted malt, dark red fruit, and sorghum. Flavor profile follows those nose faithfully. Very drinkable.
Bottle 33cl. Black with a small beige head. Malty aroma. Sweet flavour with some bitter hops, but not in balance. Too sweet for my taste.

Pours black with virtually no head.

Aroma is dark malts, liquorice, plum, cherry, blackcurrant, burnt raisin, soy sauce and molasses. Taste is sticky sweet, oily, then a long, deep, still sweet finish with great body and nice booze.

Powerful stuff, with rich and complex flavours, shame about the lack of head and carbonation.
Bottle. Black with almost no foam. Aroma of coffee, roasted, smoked and some licorice. Taste is coffee, licorice, smoked, smoked ham, and some alcohol in the back. Close to full body. Very good.

Bottle.

A- Soy sauce, teriyaki, smoke, figs, wood, roast.

A- Dark brown color, dark liquid, light brown head.

T- Wood, soy sauce, subtle alcohol, dark cherries.

P- Full body, warm texture, medium carbonation, complex finish.

O- Damn, had I paid attention to see this can age for 25 years per the label, Id have bought a ton of it. A bit pricey at $9 for 11oz but very much worth it. My bottle had a bout 1.5 years of age. Wasnt a fan at first sight with the floaties but it can be forgiven based simply on how great it smells and tastes. My 1,700th rate and my favorite style. Hell, maybe one of my new favorite beers. Everything was just so balanced and right.
Black with small tan head. Spicy alcohol, soy sauce and herbal. Sweet, complex and fruity finish. Good!
Bottle 33 cl. Black with a minimal lightbrown head. Dark fruit aroma, licorice and caramel. Light bitter, medium sweet with a warm hoppy end, som alc sense at the end. NIce

10.1% ABV with premiant and sladek hops
Bottled. Dark brown with firm beige head. Aroma of chocolate, cherry liquer. Full body, rich texture, warming alcohol, low carbonation. Balance towards sweetnes which lingers also in finish. Dark chocolate flavor, ash in finish.

UPDATED: MAR 29, 2017 Aromat śliwkowy, winny, nalewkowy, czarnych owoców, palonych słodów, ogólnie jednak dość słodki. W barwie czarne z rubinowymi przebłyskami, piany brak. W smaku dominują ciemne owoce, wędzone śliwki, jest tu sporo takiej nalewkowej słodyczy. Ciało średnie, pijalne jak na ten styl. Rozgrzewa przyjemnie. Słodycz z alkoholem przynosi na myśl belgijskiego abta, ale jest to mniej złożone. Ogólnie konkretne, smaczne piwo, nieco dla mnie zbyt słodkie ale ogólnie dobre.

UPDATED: AUG 26, 2016 Imperial fantastica. Nera impenetrabile con schiuma beige chiaro minima. Al naso intensa e avvolgente, sentori di malto tostato, dark fruits, fichi, cioccolato. Anche al palato super, è abbastanza cremosa ma bevibile, bella nota di liquirizia, cioccolato ancora ben in evidenza. Carbonazione bassa. Da bere sempre, morbida e coinvolgente.

0.33l bottle thats efficiently filled.
Dark brown with very small brown head that disappears. Smooth mouth-feel and for me little primary taste then some roasted taste.

Pours very dark brown with a small head.
Nose shows caramel, soft roast, delicate booze, figs, sultanas and some bready notes.
Flavours include soft roast, faint smoke, sweet bready notes and very soft booze.

Sample at Hair Of The Dog during the Brouwerij de Molen and Shiga Kogen Tap Takeover on 07/30/2016. Brown-black color with a medium foamy khaki head that recedes gradually to a film. Patches of lacing. Aroma of roasted malt, chocolate and coffee. Full-bodied with a roasty malt and coffee character, with some bittersweet chocolate and brine in the background. The finish is earthy malt and chocolate. Pretty good overall.
UPDATED: AUG 16, 2016 Chocolate, caramel, orange zest. No sweetness overload, bitterness subtle and not overdone. Quite elegant for a Porter.

UPDATED: SEP 7, 2016 330ml bottle from Denman Liquor store. Tasting with Jamey. Aroma is roasted malt and seeds, dark fruits, leather, caramel. Taste are pretty the same and aftertaste has additional smoky notes. Very good.

Bottle, 330 ml from Pivoteka. Shared with Miro and Kova. Pours dark brown with beige to light brown head. Roasted malts, chocolate, hazelnuts, licorice, some dark fruit. Bitter finish. Complex. Full bodied. Nice.

Bottle at home. Aroma is malt, caramel, hops, overripe fruits, pears, prunes, apricots, notes of chocolate and molasses, touch of alcohol. Flavour is medium to heavy sweet. Body is full, sticky mouthfeel. Good, but I expected a bit more from this, not roasty enough for my taste, yet nicely ripe fruity, on its way to being an English Barley Wine.

UPDATED: JUL 8, 2016 Bottle at home. Pitch black, just some offwhite bubbles. Rich milky chocolate and coffee, butterscotch, caramel, vanilla notes, not too fruity: sweet, roasted malty finish. Well balanced, long aftertaste. Firm body, low carbonation, soft mouthfeel. Like this better than their well-praised Hel&Verdoemenis.

Well thats rather good. Looks a bit dull - nice and dark but no head whatsoever. Lots going on in the aroma: chocolate of course, but also cola, floral notes, treacle and much more. Flavour has similar complex, with some dark fruit in there, but it is the chocolate that dominates and lingers longer than for any stout I can recall.
Bottle from Beer Gonzo, Coventry. Black colour. With a tan head. Big roasted malty aroma and taste. Also liquorice chocolate and sweet.
Pours pitch black with no head. Aroma: dark chocolate, cocoa and coffee. Taste: dominating cocoa and dark chocolate, coffee and roasted malt. Nice bitter finish. ABV well hidden. Very good.

Bottle, 33cL. Bottled 03/2013. 3 years old. Home. A very dark brown beer, nearly black, with a medium beige head ; average retention. Caramel (+) nose, candied fruits, roast, light prune, nutmeg, black chocolate note, alcohol. Medium sweet, round, warming, light to medium dry bitter. Full body, thin texture, light oily, soft carbonation to flat, sweet nutmeg warming lasting finish. Overall, a good strong ale ; too much caramel ; a bit rough around the edges.
330ml bottle. Pours black with tiny little beige head. Aroma of plums, chocolate, dark fruits, caramel. Medium body with soft carbonation. Taste is mostly sweet with mild bitterness in the finish.
Bastante buena. Tiene aroma a chocolate. Poco gas. Bastante cuerpo. Deja al final un sabor a ahumado ligeramente.

Bottle. Does this world need a 11% impy porter? No! So I will rid the world of this bottle. Very dark with some amber highlights. A tan head leaves sticky lacing. An earthy, cocoa aroma. Big rich very sweet malts are tasted. Just a little fruit under that and mild bitterness. Again, huge sweetness. A little dark fruit. This is like drinking a liquoer. So thick and smooth, velvety even. Brown sugar and cooca. This is not beer for someone on a diet! Despite the listed ABV I dont taste it at all. Really sweet and fortunately I like sweet beers. Really good.

Black with a brown head - Dark amlt aroma with some dark fruyity tones - Dark malt body with some chocolate and coffee flavours with hints of warming alcohol - The dark malts and chocvolate goes into the finish - This was good

Sweet, dark, dried fruits, prunes, raisins, sweet, red wine, wood, dark chocolate. Hazy, dark brown, no head. Medium sweet. Sweet, dark, toasted malts, chocolate, pralines, sweet, dried raisins and prunes, flat carbonation, full bodied, light alcohol. Stunning Imperial Porter, amazing chocolate, dark fruits, wood, extremely complex and so well-rounded. Bottle from Beer Gonzo, Coventry.

Ottima imperial Porter, come sempre quando si parla della De Molen. Sia al naso che in bocca sentori di caffè, caffé bruciato, cacao, un tocco di cioccolato, tanto liquoroso. Unica nota negativa, la trovo leggermente più acquosa rispetto alle altre del suo genere, e con bollicine quasi nulle. Per il resto, un capolavoro!
Dark brown, no head. Aroma of malt and peat. Heavy body, no carbonation. Taste is sweet.

Dark brown, almost black colour. Thin head. Lots of caramel, toffee, dark fruits, hints of berries, hints of sourness in the aroma. Hints of caramel, dark fruits, hints of coffee, toffee. Coffee and some dark fruits in the end. Liqeury hints and caramel in the aftertaste. Low carbonated, rather heavy bodied, quite well balanced beer.

Bottle; pours black with a beige head; roasted malt aroma with some hints of chocolate, coffee, and dark fruits; taste is bittersweet with chocolate, roasted malts, dark fruits, and a hint of coffee; finish is dry with hints of chocolate; very good

Cask. Pours black with a thin tan head subsiding average. Scent is old ale, emphasis grain over wood. Taste is light resin and a bit sour with nice grainy, yeasty and toffee body. Mouthfeel is amazing, soft like velvet. Finish is clean and a bit ethanol. Very great beer.
Bottle. Black with an initial bubbly head that rapidly vanishes. Lovely on the palate, sticky and hints of figs and molasses. Nice and complex.

Black colour, minimal beige head. Aroma of caramel, chocolate, roasted malt, dried fruits, vanilla, cocoa, rum, touch of alcohol. Sweet taste with light dryness and mild hoppy bitterness in finish and dry bitter aftertaste with roast. Full body and soft carbonation. Rich and complex porter, very drinkable and enjoyable.

Wygląd: czarne nieprzejrzyste, piana szybko opada. Aromat: czekolada, praliny, subtelna nuta kawy, wanilia. Smak: praliny czekoladowe, likier, kawa z mlekiem, wanilia. Goryczka lekko palona. Odczucie: pełne, aksamitne, gładkie. Alkohol rozgrzewa przełyk. Znakomite piwo. 

Appearance: black transparent, foam quickly falls. Aroma: chocolate, pralines, a subtle hint of coffee, vanilla. Taste: chocolate pralines, liqueur, coffee with milk, vanilla. Palate: full, velvety, smooth.. Excellent beer.

Bottle, pours very dark brown with a cream ring. Lots of chocolate, dark fruit, brown bread, red berries, brown sugar. Sweet, with medium to heavy bitterness, oily texture, lingering, boozy chocolate mocha finish. Nice, but not the top beer I hoped for.

Piany niemal brak. Aromat oddaje idealnie to co jest w smaku. Gęste, gladkie, moc smaku - kawa, karmel, czekolada, czego tu nie ma?! Długi slodki posmak. Alkohol genialnie ukryty, 11% a nie jest wyczuwalny wcale. Nasycenie stosunkowo niskie. Świetne piwo, małe arcydzieło.

Aroma: malt, toast, chocolate, bread. Appearance: black, clear, beige minimal head which vanished fast. Taste: medium sweetness, medium bitterness, medium sourness. Palate: full body, oily feel, average carbonation, long bitter finish.

Tap @ basement beer bar, Aalborg. Aroma of coffee, dark chocolate, roasted malt, red fruits. Black with tan head, not lasting. Taste is light+ malt bitter, moderate sweet, some from alcohol sweetness. Full body, oily texture, light carb., alcohol fruity malt finish.

Bottle, thanks, Chris. Pours dark brown/black, with a brown head. Aroma is chocolate and roasted malt. Flavor is chocolate, malt, some coffee, and a little hops. Nice and rich. Medium body, with a long, chocolatey finish.
Excellent imperial porter. Really bitter (from its hops). amazingly strong aroma and taste. Really interesting.

Appearance: Basically black, oily. Low carbonation - almost no head.
Aroma: Dark malt, toasted, coffee?
Taste: Dark malt, coffee notes, leather. Slightly toasted, but not too much. Prunes? Hides alcohol well. Very nice.
Bought: Saveur-Biere.com, 330 ml, 6.30
Info: 12/3-2016, BB: 17/11-2039

Bottle, 2007 vintage. Very dark, almost black brown color, no head. Aroma of soy sauce, basement, roast. Taste is medium bitter, light sweet. Flavor of roasty cocoa, dark chocolate, very intense, almost liqueur like. Full body, oily sticky texture, soft almost flat carbonation.
Aromen von Schokolade, Pflaumen, Rosinen und eine feine Textur bilden ein komplexes Bier mit einem wunderbar hopfigen Nachhall. 0,33l Flasche direkt von der De Molen Brauerei 3,75Euro.

11-Mar-2016-0,33L Flasche-bottled 17..11.2014. Dunkelbraun, hellbrauner sich schnell abbauender Schaum. aroma: Bitterschokolade, Rosine, Trockenpflaume. Antrunk dito, leicht medizinisch. Had much better batches, rerating will follow with another batch soon.

Pitch black colored, small not very lasting tan creamy head. Aroma is of roasted malt, some chocolate, burnt toast, decent amount of licorice and dark fruits. Taste is medium+ sweet brown sugar and chocolate, strong roasted malt and burnt toast, some licorice, medium roasted bitterness, dry finish, light alcohol notes. Medium to full bodied, soft- carbonation, creamy.
(bottle, Pivoteka Zagreb)

Bottle. Been wanting to try this one for a while. Like an idiot I jumped on a sale without checking the bottle date. Turns out its a four year old bottle. The pour is decent enough. Dark brown with a tan head. The aroma is heavily oxidized with lots of prune, raisins and almonds. Only hints of cocoa and roasted malt. The flavor is pretty cloyingly sweet. Some prune, brown sugar and cola. The body doesnt seem strong enough to support the sugary sweet flavors. There is a subtle hint of cigar ash in the finish, but the sweet, stale oxidation takes control. Overall, not too pleasant, but Im sure its due to an old bottle. Dont age this one folks. Ill have to rerate with a fresher bottle someday.

Pitch black weak head.
Smell is sweetish liquorice chocolate and background of leather and fresh cheese and nuts.
Taste is just lots of chocolate and milk chocolate. Bitter, like pure chocolate... what more to say?

26/02/2016 @home - 33cl bottle from Malt Attacks, Brussels
Dark brown with small creamy head. Nose is mocha, light roast, toffee. Taste is mocha, chocolate, caramel, soft roast bitter ending

Deep brown color, beige head. Roasted malt nose, bread, chocolate, muscovado sugar. Sweet licorice and chocolate taste, rich malty, fruity notes, hints of alcohol and coffee, light bitter finish. Full body, soft to flat carbonation.
Leicht trübes dunkelbraun mit wenig Schaum. Malzig, Röstmalze, Waldbeeren, etwas Karamell, süßlich, bitter.

Poured from 0,3L bottle, almost no head, rembants of it are brown. Black and unclear appearance. Aroma pf Baltic Porter - smoked plums, nelanoidines, some hint of burnt malts. Taste is close to a very good Baltic Porter, alcohol well hidden, its not sweet and the bitternes and hints of tar are balanced. Very good for a regular Baltic Porter, for an Imperial version I would expect sonething more, palate could have been richer.

Aroma: chocolate, dried prunes, figs, raisins
Appearance: dark, almost black with a nice head
Taste: fruits and chocolate again, some caramel notes
Palate: very rich, creamy and extremely drinkable, bitterness is delicate and soft. Very low carbonation.
One of the best beers drank in 2015!

Bottle (10.1% ABV). Black body with a thin beige head. Faint lacing. Aroma of chocolate cake, sherry, grass, blueberries and plums. Flavour of dark chocolate, grapefruit, earth and meaty malts. Medium body with a chewy mouthfeel. Light fizz. Quite hoppy for the style. This bottle had the bittering hops listed as Premiant and Sladek.

Alkohol: 11% obj. 
Ekstrakt: 23,4% wag. 
IBU: 93 
Chmiele: Premiant (CZ), Sladek (CZ) 
Kolor: Czarny. Brak przejrzystości. 
Piana: Nie jest zbyt wysoka, ale te dwa, trzy centymetry wystarczą w zupełności.
Szumowina ma kolor cappuccino i gęstą konsystencje.
Piana jest drobnooczkowa i pomimo, że nie jest czapowata pozostawia niezłe wąsy piwne. 
Zapach: WoW! Ależ ten zapach jest wielowymiarowy! Za każdym razem jak wącham to piwo czuje coś nowego.
Z pewnością czuć gęsty likier z ciemnych owoców.
Dominują śliwki, wiśnie i leśne owoce.
Nos osaczają słodkie nuty toffi, karmelu i miodu.
Żadnych aromatów chmielowych. Żadnej kwasności.

Smak: Ciemne owoce : śliwki, winogrona, daktyle.
Po chwili duża doza słodkich czereśni i dojrzałych wiśni oblanych w gęstej czekoladzie.
W następnej kolejności słodycz w postaci karmelu, toffi, cukru trzcinowego.
Tostowy i delikatny ciasteczkowy posmak od słodów.
Brak jakichkolwiek nut palonych.
Ponownie 
Co jakiś czas zerkam na etykietę i z niedowierzaniem ciągle czytam to samo: 24,4 BLG i 11% alkoholu!
Wydaje się to nieprawdopodobne.
Kompletnie nie czuć mocy alkoholu.
Goryczka jest średniej siły, krótka, znika jeszcze przed kolelnym łykiem.
Piwo ma sporo ciała, jest słodkie, przyjemne. Mogłoby być jeszcze bardziej pełne, ale być może wtedy straciłoby na pijalności.
Przy tym niesamowicie lekkie i złożone.
Pijesz je jak jakiegoś angielskiego portera 13 BLG.
Niesamowite piwo! <br/<

Wysycenie: Bliskie zera. 
Podsumowanie:  

Kolejna petarda od De Molena. Tak na prawdę uważam ich za jeden z najbardziej solidnych browarów w Europie. Nie piłem jeszcze nigdy złego ich piwa, ba nie piłem nawet przeciętnego!
Tsarina Esra jest Imperialnym Porterem.
Chociaż jak twierdzą piwowarowie to jest ich interpretacja mocniejszej wersji Porteru Bałtyckiego.
Porównywalne jest do Imperialnego Stouta, lecz bez palonych akcentów.

Carycy Esra niczego nie brakuje. Jest piwem kompletnym od A do Z w swoim stylu. Jedyną kosmetyczną poprawką mogłoby być nadanie mu większej pełni.
Poza tym zarówno smak, jak i aromat jest godny mistrzów.
Wyliczając bez końca niezliczone składowe skupię się tylko na kilku: czekolada, śliwki, czereśnie, toffi, cukier trzcinowy.
Alkohol doskonale schowany, lekkość i kremowość tworzą idealny obrazek.
Pierwszorzędny nektar!

Aroma: Very soft chocolate and caramel, licorice, red fruitiness, light licqueur alcohol, hint of hoppy herbal notes. Appearance: Very low coffee head, body is very very dark brown. Taste: Full, licqueury, chocolate with caramel, some very light coffee, fruit, light classical bitterness, minimal alcohol, nicely sweet. Palate: Body is full, carbonation is low, finish is sweet.

Rating #1603 - 14.04.2015 - Easter Dinner beers - 330mL bottle from the depths of the cellar. Pours jet black with a luxurious velvety tan head with excellent retention. Aroma is heavy on molasses, dark roast coffee, toffee, burnt sugar notes. Coffee flavours throughout, accented by vanilla bean, caramel and brown sugar notes, as well as an assertive, roasty bitterness. Exquisite.

Bottle. Nice, but unstable, small, beige head. In aroma mostly chocolate, some coffee and pleasant notes of alcohol. In taste is sweet, chocolate, some notes of coffee with great chocolote-alcoholic aftertaste. There is very low bitterness, i think thath it should be higher.
Delicious. Amazing thick and creamy mouthfeel. Incredibly smooth. Loads of chocolate, red berries, lingering mild sweetness.
Smoky cigar and fruity sour aromas. Velvety big taste. Great combination of strong porter and Kriek kind of sourness. Little sweetness brings flavours of dark chocolate and liquorice. Perfect balace!

Bottle. Teku glass. Pitch black with medium, light brown head. Deep dark fruits aroma - raisins, plums, also some toffee, caramel and light milk chocolate infused with plums. Incerdibe aroma Taste is light sweetness, well empowered by strong malty caramel notes. Medium to full body, oily texture, average carbonation. In overall great imperial porter not usual with strong hints of dark fruits and not so sweet.
Pours black with almost no head. Aromas of chocolate, dark red berries, roasted nuts, vanilla. Taste is chocolate sweetness with roasted notes. Mouthfeel is slightly oily with moderate carbonation.
Mooie zwarte kleur met medium tot kleine schuimkraag. Mooie chocolade geur. Smaak is opzich wel ok, maar heb betere op.

Dark, oily color, small stable head. A: dark malts, hint of bourbon and vanilla, plums and dark fruits, some wood notes. T: very mellow, oily mouthfeel. Deep intense dark fruits in the beginning, syrup almost. Vanilla, bourbon and wood notes in development, salmiakki, medium bitter. Strong coffee note in aftertaste, bitter.

UPDATED: JAN 20, 2016 It is a perfect beer to finish a night. The taste is sweet, vanilla and complex. The color is black and onctueux and thin foam. This beer is strong and we eat at the same time crazy. I think that it is important to drink this beer not so cold and quietly. The alcohol is present but it is not so strong and the comple aroma is well balanced, weak carbonation typical from these beers.

UPDATED: FEB 19, 2016 Ive tasted half a dozen hundred of beers. Its clearly my favourite. The aromas are coffee/chocolaty. The appearance is very nice, lacking a bit of foam though. Taste is... wonderful, caramel, coffe, chocolate, malts, spices etc. Same for the palate. 19 may be overrated, but I mean it. When I die I want to go to the Heavens and drink De Molens beers while eating great food and listening to metal. Go for it if you like imperial beers, you cannot miss this one ! Edit: the review was made out of my memory, Ive tasted this beer years ago, still my favourite.

Bottle pour at Gourmet Haus Staudt in Redwood City, CA. Aroma is malty, soy sauce, dark fruits. Taste is tangy, saucy (almost a bit of savory gravy in there), dark chocolate, chewy salted licorice, slightly herbal and bitter. Snazzy.

Un imperial porter de 11% abv, pour 23,4° plato (excusez du peu ), et un ebu de 93.
5 malts au programme : pils, munich, choco, wheat et cara. Houblonnage en premiant et sladek (différent de ce qui est mentionné sur le site ..).
Mon exemplaire affichait 1 an et 2 mois pour 25 ans prévus par le brasseur !!! (validité 11/2039...).
Couleur noir quasi intégral (ebc de 385...).
Mousse quasi inexistante, juste un léger voile en toile daraignée.
Arômes de pruneau dAgen, malt torréfié, café, pointe légère danis, piment noir.
1ère bouche souple sur malt torréfié, café, pointe admirable de foin grillé.
Arrière-bouche dense, complexe, avec du feu de bois, jambonneau.
2ème à la texture très douce. Ensemble merveilleux malt, café, fumée.
Arrière-bouche qui illumine la pensée.
3ème qui est une pure merveille où tout y est : malt, houblon, levure, bois, épice, herbes.
Arrière-bouche très longue, savoureuse.
Longueur dune grande complexité, avec une infinité de nuances, toutes plus savantes et savoureuses lune que lautre.
Jambes huileuses.
Levure dense, complexe, très grande ligne.
Alcool ferme, décidé, il ne laisse rien passer, il dirige tout.
Finale dune ampleur et dune finesse extrême.
CONCLUSION : une bière dune grandeur qui confine au magnanime... Pour une impériale, quoi de plus normal, mais en fait nous sommes bien au-delà du normal... Un 5 ne représente rien pour cette
bière merveilleuse  Pour moi, elle est au minimum à 200 sur 100 .. Comprenne qui pourra 
Et si on laisse vieillir 25 ans, alors, je ne vous parlerai pas du score ...

licorice, soy sauce, raisin, roasty, alcohol, chocolate, coffee, bit thin but good aroma.
Black colour small beige head.
Heavily salty, noticably sweet, lightly bitter, ABV evident.
Fullbodied, soft carbonation sweet licorice finish.

Piana niewielka, praktycznie od razu znika prawie do zera. Barwa ciemno brązowa, nieprzejrzysta, prawie czarna, z bordowymi refleksami u dołu i nieładnymi grudkami drożdży opadającymi na dno szkła. Aromat słodki, zdominowany przez ciemne owoce - jeżyny, wiśnie, węgierki w czekoladzie, kakao, trufle i ciemne gęste wino. W smaku nie jest może ulepkowate, ale przyjemnie słodkie, lekko popiołowe, pojawia się fajna paloność, ponownie jeżyny i borówki amerykańskie, sos sojowy, mleczna czekolada, i na szczęście niewiele kwaskowatości. Goryczka średnia do niskiej, palono tytoniowo likierowa, z tym że alkohol całkiem zgrabnie ukryty, fajnie rozgrzewający. Nagazowanie niskie, drobne, ponad półpełne w odbiorze, niestety nie oleiste.

11/XII/15 - 33cl bottle from Abbaye des Saveurs (Lille, FR) @ my dads birthday party - BB: n/a, bottled: 7/XI/11 (2015-1708) 
Clear dark brown beer, creamy irregular beige head, pretty stable, bit adhesive. Aroma: sweet, caramel, dark chocolate, malty, soft roast. MF: no carbon, full body, velvet texture. Taste: sweet start, very malty, bit sourish, mocha, some coffee. Aftertaste: bitter touch, dried fruits, prunes, cocoa powder, sweet, raisins, bready, alcohol, malty, slight oxidation. Lovely stuff!

From 0,33l bottle, BBD: 17/11/39 Pours opaque black liquid, stable brown minimal head/ lacings, Aroma: dark chocolate, sweet milky, light roasted coffee, plums, candied apricots, strawberries, Taste: medium to heavy sweet, medium to heavy bitter, light to medium sour, dark chocolate, rich fruity and candied notes, plums, strawberries, light roasty notes, light to medium yeasty notes, delicate, Palate: full body, soft to average carbonation, creamy to oily mouthfeel, long chocolate fruity aftertaste with bitter finish, Overall: enjoyed, very pleasant to marvelous imperial porter. Rich, layered, complex. Excellent.

Bottle 0,33.
Dark, almost black color. Rich aroma: spices, oak, rum, vanilla. Taste: bitter, roasted malts, hoppy finish. Well balanced. Warming. Full body.

Bottled 330ml. -from Pivoteka Zagreb. Almost black coloured, small brownish head, prunes and alcohol in the nose. Roasted malt, dried fruits (prunes), licorice and chocolate with noticable but well-balanced alcohol presence. Some wood and ash in the finish. Decent brew.

5 oz. pour at Holy Grale. Aroma: Rich chocolate and caramel malt presence that carries a moderate sweetness; really not much in the way of hop aroma. Appearance: Pitch black pour with a bubbly tan head. Flavor: Matches the nose; rich caramel with some chocolate; for a beer at 94 IBU, the hops didnt really show up for me; the finish is dry and a tad bitter. Palate: Light body, slick texture, soft carbonation, abrupt finish. Overall: Never got off the ground for me; kinda dull even.

33 cl bottle, poured in snifter glass. Poured dark brown/black with practically no head at all. Aromas of chocolate, vanilla, caramel, dark fruits. Taste continuation of the aroma with hints of hop, raisins, dark, roasted malt, hazelnuts. A full body with a slightly dry, nutty, chocolaty finish. Another nice brew from De Molen.

(Bottle) Black with tiniest tan head. Aroma of molasses, raisins, burnt toffee, roast oats and hints of cigarette smoke. Amazing palate - thick, syrupy, creamy with the subtlest of fine carbonation. Fantastic rich complex taste. The backbone is a rich dark toffee sweetness. Theres some white port notes with a sweet and sour grape hints at the start. This initial hint of lightness gives way to richer darker flavours by the mid palate - dark chocolate, raisins - which in turn give way to black coffee, burnt sugar bitterness, again with hints of cigarette smoke. Impressive beer, maybe a little sweet. (The bar code matches the second provided, however some of the details are slightly different. The deScription on the bottle is "imp. porter-ish", the ABV is 10.1%, EBC is 385 and EBU is 93.)

330ml bottle. Pours an opaque, dark brown with a thin, light brown head that leaves spotty lacing. Sweet aroma of chocolate malt, licorice, dark fruit, alcohol and a light roasted note. Sweet flavour of chocolate malt, licorice, prunes, coffee and light roast with a dry, mildly bitter, warming alcohol finish. Full body with a creamy, oily texture and flat carbonation. An excellent Imperial Porter. Well balanced and complex.

Nez: Fruité, boisé
Bouche: Pruneau, fruits confits, liquoreuse, épicée
Une excellente bière
18cl bottle from December 2010. A heavy and malty brew for sure. Boozy but with a beautiful nutty aroma, rich and full. Amazing!

Dark brown, close to black, with a very tall, tan-coloured and fine-grained head that gives way rather quickly to a thin, sticky lacing. Smells like dried fruit, sour cherries, blackberries, caramel, roasted malts, some coffee liquor. Tastes like sour cherries, roasted malts, dark chocolate and some coffee, apple brandy. Medium body, soft mouthfeel and a nice, warm and bitter-sweet finish

(330ml bottle shared @ VilleValla Pub, Linköping, Dec 11 2015) Pours a very dark brown with a medium brown head that fades rapidly without lace. Nose is a study in malts, with molasses, burnt sugar, dark chocolate, some toasty notes, prunes, and just a little liquorice. Palate is loaded with the same flavours, sweet but not cloying with the burnt sugar/molasses dark malt core, chocolate, and a little coffee. Low-moderate roasty bitterness and a little bit of piney hop towards the finish. Some plum notes and very light oxidation. Lightly salted liquorice. Finish is medium sweet and offset by the roast/hop bitterness, slight grain, and a bit of alcohol heat. Light-medium body for style, light carb, could be a bit more hefty while remaining elegant. Still very nice balanced study in malts without being too sweet or too burnt.
Sample at Örebro Öl & Whisky 2015. Malty smell with caramel. weet taste with caramel, toasted sugar and dark sugar. ery nice. Love the sweetness.

UPDATED: DEC 21, 2015 Boterzachte zoete jongen van de Molenaar. Goed spul. Backlog from 2014/11/09. 
Op tap bij Kompaan. Ahhhhhhhh lekker zacht en zoet en zwart. Backlog from 2015/09/17.

Bottle at Brasserie V. Annoyingly 2 1/2 years old. Luckily, it sort of holds up. Light oxidation notes, deep malty brown chocolate notes. Has aged pretty well.. Delicate almost Dunkel Eastern European chocolate feel. A beast of a Baltic Porter. Really delicious, sublime. A slow sipper, sugary. Solid.

Provsmakning örebro ölmässa. Svartbrun kulör. Rostad doft med kaffe och choklad. Söt och fyllig smak med med kaffe, frukt och choklad
Flaska på Örebro ÖoW. Svart med beige skum. Doft av choklad och karamell. Tung munkänsla med choklad och karamell.

A pitch black beer with a collapsing brown head. The aroma is sweet with notes of roasted malt, alcohol, coffee, prunes, and some spices. The flavor is sweet malty with strong notes roasted malt, licorice, soy sauce, prunes, and some coffee. The finish is dry woody, roasted, and bitter

W aromacie sporo suszonych owoców -rodzynki, figi, śliwki to główny nurt skontrowany czekoladą. Piany brak, wysycenie bliskie zeru. W smaku bardzo owocowe , z czekoladową kontrą, najbardziej zaskakujący jest lekko belgijski finisz. Bardzo ciekawy porter, może nie w stylu, ale szalenie przyjemny.

Bottle from Vinmonopolets BU. Pours dark brown. Thin layer of tan head, which quickly dissappears. Dark chocolate, roasted malt, coffee, vanilla, dark fruit and alcohol aroma. Roasted coffee, ripe apple, date, plum, chocolate and some canilla flavour. Velvet mouth feel. Dry ending. Thick and oily body. Soft carbonation. Sweet. Dome bitterness. Very good. A bit too much alcohol aroma and warmth make it a bitboozy though.

0.33l bottle. Black body with chunks of floating yeast, thin light-brown head. Aroma of chocolate, figs, caramel, vanilla and plums. Taste of chocolate, vanilla, caramel, plums and some floral hops. Medium bodied, suprisingly easy to drink. Wow, this is awesome.

Bottled 17 nov 2014. ABV 11%. Pours dark black with a minimal off-white, brownish head. Clear coffee appearance. Nose is predominantly coffee as well. Good roastyness, some dark chocolate, dark fruits, licorice, burned sugar as well. Good autumny aroma. Wonderful nose. Taste is moderately sweet with a nice lingering bitter undertone. Great roasty touch all along. Sugar, coffee (mocha), forest fruits, licorice and a nice hopbitter. Something porto-like as well. Great, rich and balanced taste. Wonderful use of the alcohol which bears all the flavors in an excellent way. Palate-wise a bit on the thinnish side, could have had more body and a bit more creamy texture. However an incredibly smooth Porter. Wonderfully drinkable and definitely worth another buy.

Bottle in the Grove, Huddersfield. Pours deep mahogany with a thin beige head. The aroma is rich coffee and dark chocolate. The taste is fantastic - liquorice, toffee, treacle, coffee and light spice. Sweet and sticky at first, then bitter in the finish. Mind blowingly good.

Flesje gekocht @Brouwerij De Molen. Schenkt een mooi zwart bier met een bescheiden schuimkraag. Een heerlijke Imp. Porter. Fles gekocht bij biernavigatie.nl, uitgeschonken in origineel tulp snifterglas van De Molen. Diep donker bruine, bijna zwarte kleur, met compacte lichtbruine schuimkraag, die zich snel terugtrekt, een dunne laag schuim blijft op het bier drijven. Zachte en rijke aroma's van koffie, pure chocolade, karamel, gedroogd fruit, met name vijgen en dadels, kruidkoek en zoethout. Heerlijk aroma, je wil telkens aan het glas ruiken, dat is een goed teken. De smaak laat zich het best omschrijven als zoet, zacht en fluwelig. Complex met meerdere smaaklagen. Je proeft eerst tonen van; pure chocolade, koffie, karamel, rozijnen, dadels, vijgen en behoorlijk wat zoethout en drop. In de volgende smaaklaag zit vanille, sigarentabak, hout, iets ziltige drop en anijs. De carbonatie is heel zacht met een zoetig, zacht fluwelig bijna romig mondgevoel, de alcohol van 11% is volledig verborgen. De afdronk is lang en toch vrij bitter door de hopsoorten. Deze Tsarina Esra behoort bij de beste bieren van De Molen die ik tot nu toe heb geproefd. Aangenaam aroma, complexe smaken, perfect mondgevoel,  en zachte maar toch lange en bittere afdronk. Weer een meesterwerkje dit zwarte fluweel van De Molen!

Le côté sucré est bien entendu mis de lavant mais le liquide reste dune douceur et dune légèreté déconcertante.

From notes. Tasted in early December 2012 from a 7oz nip bottle, shared with Curtis. Pours very dark brown with a minimal brown head that quickly disappears. The nose is dark and roasty with chocolate syrup, molasses, coffee and vanilla. The flavor very nicely balances bitter and sweet with roasted dark chocolate, coffee, molasses, chocolate syrup, and vanilla. The body is full with light carbonation and a long roasted and bitter coffee, chocolate, and vanilla finish.

33cl bottle served in a snifter. Pours dark brown which sits a nice black when in the glass with minimal head and carbonation. Aroma is malt extract and so the taste follows, Heavy malt presence with a good level of sweetness and bitterness in the finish. Caramel and toffee are most present with none of the typical "porterish" dryness that is characteristic of the style. Not particularly complex but massively tasty and worth seeking out.

UPDATED: MAR 17, 2016 Strong aroma of wines, alcohol, coffee and chocolate. Looks like Coca-Cola. Bitter initially and sweetens on the tongue. Complex and surprising every time. Plenty of alcohol in the aftertaste. Hardly any palate but that?s maybe a good thing. Loving this.

Bottle 0.33l from Alberto.Taste in Belgrade.Thank you so mich ippopotamo36. Pour it thick dark color with small white head.On the nose chocolate.Taste and aroma of chocolate, sweet dried dark fruits, coffee.Very good balanced.After taste Chocolate.Very good.My 700th rating :-)
Dark brown color. Chocolate, caramel, alcohol and dried fruits. Full body and soft carbonation. Taste ends bitter but starts sweet. Really nice beer!
Black pour with a tan head. Chocolate and dried fruit aromas, similar flavours with slight sourness, fair bit of sweetness, and an almost syrupy mouthfeel. Doesnt feel boozy at all

0,33 bottle purchased in Greece from the Hoppy imports and consumed in Kosovo. Pours totally black with a cappuccino-like nutty head which lowers relatively quickly leaving residual bubbling traces. Nose: while pouring the dark chocolate and the dates blast the nose. Impressive aroma: macerated cherries, raspberries, milk chocolate. Mouth: under spirit fruit, alcohol pungently hits and clean the palate. Typical De Molen sensation. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

(Drinking date: 21 December 2014) Aroma of chocolate, ripe figs, bit of smoke. Pitchblack beer. Small layer of beige foam. Taste starts sweet and ends bitter. Really bitter at the end, like when you drink coffee. The sweetness at first is pretty sweet. Delicious taste!! The mouthfeel is perfect for this type of beer. Smooth, silky, thick, sticky. Low in carbonation. Really good, really delicious beer! Total score: 4.4!

Aroma: chocolate, coffee, sour aroma of dark malts, dark fruits
Taste: medium sweet, medium sour, low bitter, too sour for a porter

Crazy, crazy beer. Almost like a porter/quad hybrid. Rich fruitiness, a bit leathery, chocolatey, a touch of peat, not roasty. Big issue: its really sweet, and hard to finish even with light sipping over a long period of time. But the flavors are quite good.

From a bottle dated 4/25/14 - Pours a thick black with thin tan head. There seems to be a million little yellow thing floating in the beer all over. The aroma is totally of dark fruit. The floaters are freaking me out but Ill taste it anyway. Mmmmmm chocolate roasted malts this is good. Overall its a thick beer that tastes great. I have some more in the basement and that is good plus I want to see if it has the floaters. This is one of if not the best porter Ive ever had.
Pours black, dense foam. Lot of caramel, dried fruits, dark fruits, candy sugar, brown sugar, a touch of chocolate. Maybe more a quadrupel, but good.
Heavy - almost too heavy porter. Nice foam at start. Long an heavy aftertaste. Strong 11%

I agree, I surrender. This is fantastic. I had a fun time walking to the train in the rain after this. Thank goodness for the small glass. Lightly boozy. Light anise and dark malts. As the dearly departed Steve Irwin would say..."Danger! Danger!" A lovely hop infused finish.

Very dark brown color, average sized brown head. Aroma of dark fruits, chocolate, caramel. Medium to full body, soft carbonation. Not as thick as porters with similar abv and it leaves some kind of  "sparkling water feel", so its easier to drink. Alcohol is not noticeable. Excellent, little bit different imperial porter.
Bottle from Hop City Birmingham. Pours dark black with tan head. Aroma of wood, chocolate, malt and caramel. Tastes of caramel, smoky wood, chocolate, with a malty and bitter aftertaste.
Kraftig, mörk frukt, fantastiskt fyllig i både smak och kropp. Balans med mörka toner.

from draft at van moll. poured a dark black colour with a nice mocha coloured head, sweet dark chocolate, roasted malts, some vanilla, lots of roast, ash, tabacco, dark red fruits, damn fine beer with a full bodied mouthfeel!
Bottle at home. Black with thin tan head. Aromas of roasted coffee, dark chocolate, molasses, wood. Taste is lightly sweet, medium bitter. Medium-full body, rounded mouthfeel. Delicious!

Bottle. Black with small beige head. Big chocolate, sweet malts, nuts, like an chocolate pudding with extra cocoa and a shot of cognac. Also some ripe red fruits. Quite sweet with roasted bitter finish and a lingering citrus peel aroma. Full bodied with slightly sticky feel. Very good.

Bottle 07/11/2011
Absolutely sensational cake like mocha chocolate nose. Unfortunately still quite fizzy/acidic and rather thin on the palate. Burp inspiring actually. Nose continues through to the palate but is dominated by that fiery acidity. Good but this could have been outstanding with better balance on the palate.

33 cL bottle at home. Pours pitch black with a medium tan head. Aroma has quite some licorice, dark chocolate, alcohol and some molasses. Taste has molasses, licorice, some alcohol and dark chocolate. Over medium body, medium carbo. Bit too sweet and alcoholic for me.

UPDATED: DEC 16, 2014 330ml bottle served in a snifter glass.
A: Pours a dark brown color forming a medium and thin bubbled tan head. Low retention but with a thin layer remains forever on the top of the liquid. A lot of spotty and molasses lacings are left in the glass. 
S: Strong notes of roasted malts and wood. Whiskey. Dark dry fruits, caramel, dark chocolate and flowery hops. 
T: Slightly sweet upfront. Roasted malts, dark dry fruits, oak, caramel, dark chocolate and coffee. A little bit sour. Balanced bitterness. It does not feel like 93 IBU. 
M: Heavy molasses body. Medium to low carbonation. Roasted caramel aftertaste. 
O: Great drinkability. De Molens masterpiece.
Bottle from öllepood nr2, pärnu. Black color, brown head. Aroma is roasty, coffee, chocolate. Taste is roasted malts, coffee, rye bread, sweet cognac notes.

Bottle thanks to bytemesis. Pours clear dark brown with short-lived frothy tan head. Aroma brings marshmallows, molasses, dark fruit. Initially there was a strong roast/borderline ashy undertone, but that was gone by the end of the glass. Taste is sweet, with soft roast bitterness in the finish. Palate: medium+ body, smooth texture, average carbonation. Overall: Tasty beer -- appropriately on the softer/sweeter side compared to the other big stouts Ive had from them.

Bottle at home from ales by mailone Ive wanted to try for a while but not quite as expected. Oxidised with some older fullers vintage notes. Fruity, weetabix, minty, cocoa. Sweet, heavy, definitely baltic porter based. Some metallic notes, long minty finish.

Bue à quelques reprises, probablement trop chaud pour la fixer sur ratebeer, voilà je le fais. Noix de coco, chocolat, caramel et autres sucres accostent massivement dans ma bouche. Les houblons ne sont que spectre, la chaleur dalcool volcanique, jaime bien ce monstre.

12 oz bottle dated 05/04/12. Pitch black with a touch of sand color head. Aroma is a tonne of euro malt. Taste is licorice and molasses. Very roasty. Hides the 11% pretty well. Decent, but not as impressive as all the barrel aged ones Ive had from them.

33cl bottle @ home. Pours black with a quick fading beige head. Aroma is roasted malt, chocolate, coffee, alcohol and molasses. Flavour is sweet and light bitter. Full bodied, soft carbonation. Finish is long, medium sweet with coffee and roasted malt.

Drucken på Norrlands Nation, Uppsala. Mycket fin och lagom tunn. Lite lätt kaffe, tunn kropp med tanke på alkoholstyrkan. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
I am not the huge fan of porters but this one didnt taste like one and was more like a smoked stout

0,33l bottle from Bierkoning, Amsterdam. Aged for 2,5 years. Pours very dark brown with a low tan head. Aroma is sweet roasted malts with some alcohol. Deep flavor is sweet roasted malts, cherries, madeira, alcohol and some hops. Exquisite.

0,33 pullo@ Hermanna. Ei kovin samea, punaiseen taittava tummanruskea. Tuoksussa ihan hento savuisuus, sherryä, alkoholia, ylikypsää kirsikkaa. Maku pehmeän täyteläinen, suklainen, tummaa punaista marjaa ja säilöttyä kirsikkaa.

Piwo z kranu. W zapachu słony sos sojowy dominuje, poza tym lekkie nuty czekolady i kawy. Kolor czarna smoła, nieklar, piękna beżowa pianka cudnie lepi szkło i trzyma się do ostatniego łyczka, wysycenie średnie. W smaku ziemistość, rodzynki, lekko słone, nuty karmelowe, kawowe i likier śliwkowy, lekko wędzone(?). Bardzo przyjemna i dobrze ułożona chmielowa gorycz na finiszu. Z minusów mogę jedynie powiedzieć że czułem lekkiego gwoździa a poza tym super piwo.
Dark brown/black small light brown little lacing foam head. Aroma is stark bitter coffee. Bitter coffee taste, some roasted bread tones. Smooth still. Bitter aftertaste. (Velp 201409)

Serving: Small bottle. Black pour with a decent tan head. Powerful nose full of port, coffee, raisin, dates, and earth notes. Certainly warming at 11% with a nice forward sweetness followed by coffee liqueur, slight anise, and a little earthy bitterness. Well balanced for what it is. Rather tasty.

330ml bottle, thanks to Benzai! Pours black with slight brown hue. Thin off-white head, strong boozy fruitcake aroma. Tate is swirling caramel malts, dark fruits and a curious sweetness with a slight grainy texture. Absolutely delicious!

Igen csekély, szinte csak a kitöltés pillanataiban jelenlévő, majd egy vékony gyűrű formájában megmaradó habbal, és kólaszínű testtel rendelkező imperial porter a De Molentől, mely utóbbi pár jellemvonás már eleve stabil alapot ad a bizakodásra. Tömött, nehéz illatokkal mutatkozik be a pörkölés során előálló valamennyi létező aromával és egy masszív rumos kávés, vaníliás öntettel. Kissé átlátszó, kevésbé testes főzeteket idéző színe legnagyobb meglepetésünkre egy haraphatóan testes, krémesen lágy szénsavtartalommal megélénkített, fahordóban érlelt kávéturmix benyomását kelti, majd további képzavarokhoz alapot kínálva egy istállós jegyekkel megbolondított, túlsúlyos sour ale és feszes imperial stout házasságának gyümölcse kel életre. Ennyire izgalmas porterrel még nemigen találkoztam, bár ez esetben talán még kevésbé érzem sajátomnak a stout és a porter imperial jellegének megkülönböztetésére vonatkozó képességet. Egyszerre komor, sült húsos és egyéb szaftos-ételes, valamint likőrös, diófagylalt-szerű, alkoholos-tejkészítményes sörkülönlegesség, amiért igazán megéri pénzt áldozni.

Bottle from Kris Wines. Date on the bottle is 2011. Ive had this bottle about 2 years, maybe more. Pours a little oily, black to very dark brown with a tan brown head, big and foamy. Nose is very malty, yeasty, yeast extract, Marmite, little salty, dark chocolate, black sugar. Sweet and savoury. Taste is roasted malt, big yeasty, yeast extract, Marmite, little salty, black sugar, black coffee, maybe a slight bit of coffee, caramel, some alcohol hotness and hop bitterness and tanginess. Finish is alcohol hot, yeasty, salty, Marmite, bit of caramel, hop resin and slight ale fruitiness. Nice thick mouthfeel, big thick flavours.

UPDATED: APR 7, 2017 Very strong porter with delicate, deeply beige head which needs a bit of forcing to be fully formed, colour very dark burgundy, almost black. Very rich, deep, tantalizing aroma - one of those sniffing beers I love so much, with hints of raisins, kahlua, old port wine, candied cherries, pear, brown sugar, honey, gin, liquorice, peat, ginger... Complex, very liquorice-like onset with even some saltiness only adding more complexity, low carbo, very thick, resinous and oily mouthfeel, profound nutty, caramelly and chocolatey maltiness, dry spiciness, intense roasted bitterness in the finish with a smoky, tobacco-like quality, again that subtle saltiness, strong gin-like warming alcohol but nowhere astringent, very mouth-filling.  Great beer and exemplary for the imperial porter style certainly within Europe.  Does not, however, seem to age all that well, as a vintage sample of 5+ years old was significantly thinned by age already, and had developed a not all too attractive chicken broth-like flavour...

330 ml bottle at home, bottled 08/11/2011. Black color with big beige head that quickly disappears and leaves a ring until the end. Aroma is roasted malty, some chocolate, (dark) fruity - raisins, hazelnut and alcohol when it gets warmer. Taste is sweet, malty, a little bit fruity. Almost full body, creamy, soft carbonation, bitter alcoholic and a little bit smoked finish.

Clear dark brown with minimal brown head. Roasted malts with licorice, dark chocolate and cocoa, hint of hops and ashes. Lovely warm taste, balanced roasted malts full of chocolate with light licorice fading into light bitter ending with aromatic hoppy aftertaste.

Appearance: Dark/brown black with cm thick beige head.
Aroma: Acetic, citrus, subtle treacle and liquorice, malts. Smells a bit like a geuze.
Taste: Low bitterness, low/medium sweet and sourness.
Palate: Medium thick smooth texture and body, average carbonation, lingering, treacle, acetic, chocolate, fruity, whisky peaty note, with gentle alcohol warmth in the finish.
Comments: Good but perhaps a bit young.

Bottle at ALEhouse, Riga. Beer that I used to finish my short session. Pours black with a small head. Looks a bit intimidating with all its blackness. Probably a good thing though. Aroma is sweet, slightly, but only slightly hoppy, dark fruits and some lactose sweetness too. Taste is mainly sweet with some residual bitterness lingering around after you take a sip. Dark fruits, liquorice, nuts. Quite powerful stuff, this one is really for slow drinking. Well executed and another great beer by De Molen.

Bottle. Dark murky brown with a decent tan head. The aroma is chocolate, dense rich malt, light coffee, a light hop note and yeast. The flavour speaks loudly of chocolate, with rich slightly sweet malts, light coffee, leather, some berry notes, with a final that is almost tart with an impression of dark ripe cherry. The aftertaste is long with chocolate and a woody note. Great beer.

Bottle @ bierhuyske 

Pours black , slow rising grey head . 
Smell is coffee bitter 
Taste is roasted , coffee . very intense , bit sweet , some chocolate . Very thick mouthfeel , perfect carbo

Bottle. Light dark dark brown pour with a small head that quickly fades. Nose has roasted malts, licorice and some vanilla. Taste has some light tartness, portwine, some vanilla and some roast. Pretty good!
bread, cereal, medium sweetness, medium bitterness, lightly sour, full body, thick feel, average carbonation, long finish
