Oh my this is lovely stuff. Had this on tap at Canterbury Beer festival yesterday and it is a stunner. Its dark with a small head and carbonation, not much lacing around, but the taste! This was without a doubt my fav beer of the evening. Def worth the hangover the next day. chocolate, roasty, it wasnt bitter or sour, it was just awesome can you tell ;)

Bottle at Julians, Providence. Bottled 05/04/12. Pours very dark, really still with no head to speak of. Aroma somewhat bizarre, albeit alluring, raspberry, chocolate, orange rind. Body dense and rich, finish very boozy, with some milk chocolate notes, dried fruit. Effing superb.

Bona cervesa, és equilibrada i gustosa.
Buena cerveza, es equilibrada y sabrosa.
Bottle. Black. Soft salty, sort of engine oily. Nkce body, not too hot. Some espresso there.-- bb

Bottled 25.03.13. Dark brown. Small beige head. Strong aroma of sweet chocolate, gras, pine and hop bitterness. Strong taste, with pine and juniper. Pine, juniper, chocolate and bitterness in long aftertaste. Well balamced for the high ABV.
Dark brown with small off-white head. Aroma is dark chocolate, nuts and coffee.Taste is dark chocolate, coffee and toffee.

Tap. Pours dark dark brown, espresso head, small and great lacing. Aroma is loads of chocolate and sweet. Some raisins and caramel. Taste is medium sweet, light body, really dry bitter aftertaste. Some roast. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Tap @ Fermentoren, Aarhus. Pours a deep black with some brownred hues. Aromas of chocolate, coffee, burned malt, yeast, slight nutty and earthy. Taste is quite nutty, yeasty and quite sweet. It almost has some triple/quad-like hints to the sweetness. Not very roasted and finishes very sweet. Could use some more body and roastedness.

Bottled Apr 2012. Opens with a ffft. Dark brown, forms a massive tan head, some short-lived lacing. Aroma is chocolate, sour caramel, yeasty, lightly metallic. Quite a strong smell, but not that inviting. Body is medium, smooth, low carbonation, a little foamy. Taste is soft malts, a little ash, redcurrent, coffee. Aftertaste is burnt coffee and salted butter. From the smell I thought something was amiss, but it tasted good.

UPDATED: FEB 28, 2016 0,33L fles, do keer bruin met een bruinE kraag. Geur is typisch geroosterde mout koffie en cacao maar ook zoet stroop schriftuur. Smaak begint vol zoet met wederom de stoop. In de afdronk komt ook het hopbitter en alcholwarmte. Niet helemaal in balans en wat te zoet.
UPDATED: OCT 31, 2014 DWF. 0.33 flaske. Skum som varer. Aroma av sjokolade røykt malt,  gjær. Smak av malt og gjær. Drit god.
330ml bottle shared with jeevan, some time ago. Pours black with a thin tan head. Big roast coffee aromas, some sweet caramel. Taste is sweet but rounded out with roast bitterness. Good sipper.

Bottle 33cl. (bottled 21-3-2013) @ home. Sweet aroma, roasted malts, dark fruits, dark chocolate, brown sugar, coffee, vinous (fortified wine), some licorice; opaque black color, one finger creamy tan head, recedes after a while to foamy rim and light lacing; taste is moderate sweet, light roast, chocolate, coffee; smooth creamy mouthfeel, full-bodied, low carbonation; velvety sweetbitter aftertaste.

33cl bottle. Color is dark copper to brown and dark. Head is very thin. Taste is high bitter and low sweet. End is quite long and warm. Aroma and flavour is dried fruits, fresh fruits, chocolate, caramel, malty, alcohol. Wasnt expecting this. I was expecting better :-)

Between a Porter and a Baltic Stout...Chocolate, caramel, alcohol (Baltic hints) with a complete mouthfeel (Porter hints) and a soft carbonation. 
Hop complexity with a well balanced progressive strike.

Aroma: Chocolate, coffee, nuts, wood, alcohol
Appearance: Dark with little tan head. Small liqueur lacing.
Taste/Palate: Full body, liqueur, soft carbonation, complex bitterness. Dark and bitter chocolate, coffee, some notes of smoked wood, toffee, hops. Complex beer but really balanced. Heavy, strong, sweet and bitter with a great drinkability.

Bottle from the Bierkoning. Dark, black pour with receding brown foam. Aroma is roasty, molasses and anise, quite boozy. Taste is malty, lots of anise, molasses, dark chocolate, light roast, strong alcohol warmth in the finish. Palate is full bodied, light carbonation, nice coating creamy palate. Good sipper.

Wow. Ive had a few stunning porters in the last year, and this is certainly on the pile of the best. Strong sugar nose, earthy fruits, and a flavour that marches from the front of the tongue to the back. Sweetness, sharpness from the alcohol, to bitterness, and then a dessert like finish that ties all of those experiences together each mouthful. Truly wonderful. If I can secure another few bottles, Ill happily let it rest a few more years! truly stunning.
Very good porter. A lot of stout notes. Aroma is sugars like brown sugar and chocolate. A sweeter beer with a thin plate but tons dessert flavors and a lite hoppy bitter finsh.

Botella de 33 cl en Cimmeria 12-04-2014 en el momento. Embotellada en 25-03-2013 y para 25 años. Color caoba tirando a negro con espuma beige bastante oscura y no muy persistente. Aromas iniciales ligeros a mieles de montaña y brezo ligeramente tostadas con maderas empapadas de licor y pequeños toques de chocolate y algo de café. Cuerpo fuerte (11 vol.) con gran sensación alcohólica en todo momento aunque a medida que va calentando va haciéndose mas ligera en paso por boca convirtiéndose casi como un licor. Sabores bastante dulces mieles negras y caramelos tostados toques de maderas con licor y algunos quemados, algo de chocolate. Gran cerveza sensación alcohólica y sabores intensos en todo momento. Para repetir de nuevo sin duda.

Kaatuu snifteriin hyvin tummanruskeana/mustana ja pienellä noin sormen paksuisella vaahdolla, joka jättää kevyttä pitsiä. Hajussa on vahvimpana lakritsia ja salmiakkia. Melkein yhtä vahvana on kahvista paahteisuutta ja juurimaisuutta. Haju on hyvin tasapainossa. Maku on hyvin vahvaa salmiakkista otetta, hiven heikompana on tukevaa lakritsisuutta. Alla on jonkin verran juurimaisuutta ja maanläheisyyttä, jonkin verran havuisuuttakin tuntuu aivan maun loppupuolella tuoden hieman raikkaamman vivahteen tullessaan. Suutuntuma on hyvin tukeva ja tuhti, kokonaisvaikutelma on hivenen hyökkäävä pysyen kuitenkin miellyttävänä. Todella hieno imperial porter, melko monipuolinen tapaus salmiakkisuuden ollessa kaikkein vahvimpana. Voisin kuvitella, että omaan suuhuni sopii paremmin näin kuin tuoreena (pullotettu 21.3.-13), ja humalointi (93 IBU) on tasaantunut.

Small bottle. Pours dark brown-black with tan head. The head doesnt stay. Aroma is vinous fruits, raisins, berries, and slight alcohol. Taste is raisins, malt, dark fruits, wood, and licorice. Finish is fruity and coffee bitter. Overall: great beer.
Aroma is dark malts, chocolate, fruit and vinous notes. The flavor is dark malts, dark fruit/vinous, berries, chocolate and a mildly sour/tart/warming finish.

Bottle shared by martjoobolut, thanks! Dark brown, tan head. Nose is malts with sour hints, roast, sweetness, alcohol, dark fruits. Taste is similar to the nose, more dark fruits and sweetness, berry tones, sourness, ash, wood, alcohol. A very nice balance. Thick, sticky palate.

Bottle 330 ml at home, into a snifter, no bottling date on the label, ABV 11%
Pours a very dark brown and almost totally black beer, with one finger of brown head, thick, with very good retention, leaving some big bubbles and foam islands on the surface and light lacing around the glass.
Aroma is heavy on dark fruits with lots of plums, molasses, very sweet in general, some chocolate, sugar, shery.
Taste is moderate sweet, with lots of chocolate and roasted malts too, ash, wood, very well hidden alcohol, some fortified wine notes.
Very thick body, low carbonation that works grear, quite sticky on the palate. 
Overall a great beer.

330l bottle from Cimmeria, Oviedo.@home 21-04-14.
BBD: 25-03-13.
In short: a viscous dark ale.
Pours very dark with little tan head. Short head retention, some lacing. Roasty, wood, liquor, spicy aromas. Medium body, silky texture, soft carbonation. Taste follows the nose, moderate bitterness, some hot finish.Smooth, balanced and enjoyable.

From tap @ BBF 2014. Pours dark brown to black with a moderate, beige head. Aroma is sweet with notes of dark fruits, plums, olives, light caramel and possible some light chocolate. Flavor is sweet and bitter with a long duration, olives, honey, roasted malt, sticky.

How: Draught.
Where: The Bishops Arms (Folkungagatan), Stockholm.
Appearance: Black colour with a beige head.
Aroma: Chocolate, coffee, hints of sour cherries, alcohol.
Body: Full body, low carbonation.
Flavour: Chocolate, dark fruit. Vinous finish.

Bottle. Label has no "Imperial Porter" line on it. This beer just appeared on the local shelves recently but the one I got today was bottled over a year ago. I wonder where they kept it all this time? So I guess I am rating an aged sample now. Dark brown body with a minimal head. Aroma has smoked almonds, scotch and medium smoky roast. I am already drooling. Oily mouthfeel. Taste reflects the aroma. Very good. I would like to try a lighter version of this beer too - that would be a regular "Baltic Porter" then?

Pours pitch black. Minimum thick head. Nose is superb, sweet with dried friuts like raisin, plums and cherries. Taste is initially thin then flavours like the nose with bitter finish. Perfect body, oilish and thick. Love this beer, as usual from De Molen.
Doft: är dunder förkyld...men känner en rund sprit doft. Smakar: mjuk kaffe med choklad ton. Väldigt god!
Botella. Presencia pobre y bajo carbónico pero un precioso coló caoba oscuro. En boca dulce y alcohólica con dejes de chocolate equilbrada y final ligeramente picante y buen amargor.
Pours a deep almost opaque brown colour with no head. Aroma is malty, toffee, chocolate, roast, alcohol, and some spicy hops. Flavour is caramel, plum, toffee
Direi davvero un gran bel bere, molto calda, avvolgente, corposa, profumata, vinosa, fruttosa...

Bottle from Cornelius. Woompa yes indeed sir. Big velvet monster tickling the senses. Boozy choco coke raisin plum. Soft palate subtle fizz tingles. What better way to while away a train journey surrounded by business bores.

Ins Glas ergießt sich ein sehr dunkelbraunes Bier mit schöner bräunlichen Schaumkrone. Geruch sehr röstmalzig, schokoladig, Kaffee, dunkle Früchte. Geschmack sehr röstmalzig schokoladig, Kaffee, dunkle überreife Früchte, minimal säuerlich.
12oz bottle pours a dark black with a tan khaki head. Roasted malt and chocolate powder aroma. Raisin and dark fruit taste.

Bottle. Dark brown, light beige head of dense foam. Dusty cocoa, light aniseed, treacle, and old sun-bleached dried out wood. Not much in the way of hard roast. Medium sweetness, full bodied, bitter finish without any fruity aromatics. Very enjoyable.
user_location: the land of bitumen, beef & beer, Alberta, CANADA

text:
2014.03.21 - De Molen Tsarina Esra - 11.2 oz bottle at Brewsters in L.A.

Aroma: pretty neutral but has some earthy tones and trace sweetness. 7/10

Appearance: pours not totally but pretty dark, pretty much what you'd expect for imperial porter. 4/5

Taste: as in the description, pretty much a stout without the obvious roasted flavor. A bit of clear sweetness on the front end similar to de Molen barley wines, etc. Resolves to a very subtle roast flavor. Little to no alcohol burn, de Molen does a good job of making smooth high abv beers. 8/10

Palate: very smooth, sweetness, almost no carbonation, similar to other de Molens I have tried. 4/5

Overall: very nice. Turbocharged porter, quite smooth. 16/20

On tap @ LExpress de Lyon (Paris). Dark brown with a medium beige head and some lacing. Aroma is of raisins, liquorice, vinous notes, red fruits, roasted malt and wood. Taste is slightly sweet with raisins, liquorice, vinous notes, vanilla and roasted finish. Full bodied. Medium carbonation. Vinous mouthfeel. Good Imperial Porter. Interesting complexity. Impressively vinous for a non barrel-aged beer.

Barwa: ciemna, pod światło rubinowa, lekko zmętniona. Piana biała, niewielka, niemal natychmiast opadająca. Wysycenie niskie, całość dość gęsta i oleista. 

Aromat: owoce, karmel, czekolada. Dla mnie za mało porterowy. 

Smak: słodki owocowy, czekoladowy, z goryczkową kontrą i rozgrzewającym finiszem. 

Miałem dość duże oczekiwania wobec tego piwa (podsycane jeszcze wysokimi notowaniami na RateBeer), bowiem bardzo chętnie siegam po wszelkie portery, zwłaszcza w mocniejszych wersjach. Ten niestety zapamiętam głównie z wysokiej ceny, którą musiałem za niego zapłacić. Portery lubię bowiem przede wszystkim za ich ciemną barwę oraz czekoladowe i kawowe akcenty. Niezbyt przemawiają do mnie natomiast wersje jaśniejsze z nutami owocowymi. Mając tylko takowe do wyboru, zdecydowałbym się zapewne na opisywany uprzednio litewski porter z browaru Vilkmerges, który choć słabszy pod względem alkoholu wcale nie ustępuje w smaku czy aromacie De Molenowi. Do tego ma większą pojemność i jest tańszy. Czy zatem warto przepłacać?

Great surprise.. its not only comparable with IMPs, but beats many of them. Pleasant roasted maltiness with notes of smoked, wood, licorice, choco decent hops makes this brew quite complex and highly enjoyable.
Sweet with interesting bitterness combo from roasted malts and hops Very smooth. Awesome brew, must grab some more

Dark brown, almost black. Small beige head. Roasted aroma, coffee, raisins and chocolate. Thick, sticky mouthfeel. Soft, vinous alcohol appears after a while. Some sweetness. Soft carb and bitter finish. Delicious.

(draught) pours black in colour with a creamy beige head. aroma of heavy brown sugar and vanilla, dark chocolate, cherries, some light fudge and herbal hops. flavour is mostly brown sugar and heavy toasted malts, with a medium sweetness, a hint of treebark and some earth. heavy-bodied with soft carbonation.

2 brothers tasting day 2. Bottle from Cotteridge wines. Very dark brown with small tan head that reduces to just a rim around the glass. Aroma of raisins, pontefract cake and dark fruits. Taste is pontefract cake, figs, dark toffee and some hop bitterness. Full bodied oil slick on the tongue with a touch of carbonation. Very good.

text: Two brothers beer tasting night 2. Bottle cotteridge wine. Dark brown colour halo tan head. Aroma is rasins dark fruits liquorice. Taste is similar strong alcohol medium full body oily mouthfeel soft carbonated v good v strong.

bottle from pivni rozmanitost. black at first glance but held up to the light it revealed a purple tinge; aroma of red berry, wet tobacco, licorice and coffee cream; loads of flavour - chewing tobacco and dark chocolate dominate; luscious texture; each sip more and more interesting

Denso color nero con spesso e preesistente cappello di fragile schiuma beige. Al naso offre sentori di pane nero, segale, malto abbrustoliti e caffè espresso; al palato è dolciastra e zuccherosa con note di cereali, caramello, frutta secca, fondi di caffè e cacao amaro. Corpo medio, meno intenso dellatteso, effervescenza debole, struttura setosa, finale amarognolo e velatamente luppolato.
Sort i fargen med litt rødskjær, lys brunt lavt skum. Kakaopulver og kaffelukt. Bitter kaffe og mørk sjokolade, og søtlige karamelltoner. Salt i ettersmaken i tillegg til det bitre.

Aroma is very very rich molasses and dark sweet maltiness.Some chocolate notes too. Taste is very sweet cara malts. Complex rich maltiness with hints of raison and butterscotch.Finishes with a light bitternes and roastiness. Appearance is very dark with a creamy beige head that retains well.

Tap at BKL 2014. Vineous, boozy, dark chocolate and charcoal aroma. Black, creamy brown head. Deep deep chocolate and coffee notes, staranis and cummin in the background. Medium full mellow body, light sparkles. Espresso and brown sugar aftertaste, hop bitterness, aromatics and salt break it appart

UPDATED: FEB 20, 2014 Bottle from biernavi.de, bottled 04/11/2011. Black body with a beautiful, medium, pretty stable, very creamy, tan head. Wonderful aroma of melting chocolate, ripe banana, dried fruits, caramel, some coffee and roast, some nuts, even some smoke. Taste is also delicious, with dark chocolate, coffee, nuts, dark fruits, toffee, wood, again some subtle smoke. Mouthfeel is satisfying, full, creamy, with the right amount of carbonation and it finishes complex, slightly dry, with warm alcohol, bitter chocolate, roasted coffee, wood, some dark fruits. What a great, dark and complex beer! Perfectly balanced and although heavy and strong, quaffable to drink. Delicious!
shared at my home with Yves dark brown black colored body with a small off white head and a spicy malt hop aroma a spicy malt hops sweet fruity alcholic bitter taste with a alcholic bitter finish

UPDATED: MAR 23, 2017 5-MAR-2017. BOTTLE 33CL. Dark Brown, almost black, beige head. Full dried fruit aroma, raisins, prunes, slightly smoky. Rich fruity taste, moderate smoky and grassy bitterness. Smooth body. Light warming alcohol. Excellent. 8-4-8-4-17=4,1



14-FEB-2014. BOTTLE 33CL from dEnk, thanks Colin!

Look: deep dark brown with red highlights, cloudy, small beige head.
Aroma: too much yeast, strong caramel, dried fruit, some alcohol.
Taste: sweet, dried fruit, light roast, light alcohol, ash.

Not sure what went wrong here, but it was a bit of a disappointment. Especially the yeasty aroma. 7-3-8-4-15=3,7

33 cl. bottle poured in to a snifter. Bottled in 2012. Pitch black with a dense, tanned head. Roasted aroma with coffee, chocolate, roasted malts, sweet liquorice, a good amount of herbal hops and a hint of smoke and alcohol. Taste is sweet and roasted. Full body with a smooth, creamy texture and a soft carbonation. Finishes dry and bitter with coffee, chocolate, roasted malts and some fruity-wooden notes. Excellent and silky Porter.
Zwart bier, geen schuimkraag. Aroma van koffie, appelstroop, toast. Smaakt naar koffie, hoestdrank. Lekker.
Thick black beer with an oily mouthfeel. Taste of coffee, chocolate and malt. Good beer.

Bottiglia 33cl bevuta a casa.
Color caramello scuro, schiuma fine e persistente.
Poco carbonata, corpo medio, buona beva nonostante la gradazione, finale amaro.

11.2 oz bottle. Pours black as midnight with a brief brown head that settles to a persistent film on the surface. Aroma loudly boasts of roasted coffee and chocolate. Fairly sweet and lightly bitter, this is a full body Imperial Porter thats thick, moderately sticky, and soft on the carbonation. Long bitter finish. The label says to enjoy it within 25 years  but it only lasted a day-and-a-half at my house!

Cask at The Grove, Huddersfield. 20.01.13. Was meant to be on tap, but the keykeg liner had split, and so was decanted into a cask! Clear, dark, chestnut brown. Bubbly, tan head. Dark chocolate mints. Vimto fruit cordial. The chocolate mint is there when tasting. Smooth, alcohol warmth evident (even after 5 hours in The Grove!). Long, bitter finish. Delightful. And scarily easy to drink, too!

2007 vintage, 75 cl first bottling, #202/217. Major cheers to NoiZe for this one. This is arguably one of the finest beers by De Molen Ive had. This has been on the bottle for 6 years and theres no oxidization. Big molasses, coffee, candy sugar, soy sauce. Classic Molen smells and flavors going on here. Mouthfeel is soft and velvety, absolutely delicious.

18cl bottle #095 @ home. Black body with a medium light brown head. Nice coffee, chocolate notes with some roasted malt in the aroma. Flavour is bitter, coffee, chocolate, hops, roasted malt, molasses, some sweet bourbon-ish notes. Smooth and silky mouthfeel. Great.

Bottle. Blackish beer with a strongish head. The aroma is roasted and sweet with bitterness. The flavour is very vinous with a high degree of maltiness, bitterness and some roastedness. Overall a nice strong dark ale.

330 ml bottle, pours almost black with no head, looks like a glass of cola. Chocolate malts with a silky smooth texture, dried fruit flavours in the background. Finish is short and balanced. Alcohol is hidden well. Carbonation soft. Very nice indeed.
Black with small tan head, aroma is smooth, beef stock, wood. Flavours of liquorice, coffee, chocolate and something meaty. Lovely beer.

Aroma: Malts, hint of chocolate, little roast (chestnut), caramel (molasses) Appearance: Brown, amber, red glow, of white to beige head, quite fizzy, hazy, little see through, light lace, quickly disappearing head Taste: Coffee, little red forestfruits, chocolate, little sweet, roast, bit dry bit bitter finish, taste is very nice

Bu en bouteille de 33cl, un oeuil très sombre avec une mousse qui cependant tombe très vite, une note très chocolatée en bouche (cest normal en même temps) mais surtout on a une fin de bouche complexe sur des notes grillés caféïnés, très bonne

Refrigerated 11.2 oz. brown bottle poured into a snifter. Pours black with small dark brown highlights and very small beige head. Aroma is rich roasty chocolate, medium/thick body, low carbonation, and little thin small bubble lacing. Taste is roasty, dark chocolate, some herbal hops, and some dark fruit, Best imperial porter I have had so far.
Chocolat ultra-présent dans cette bière exceptionnelle. Arôme, palais et finale.

Noire aux reflets bruns a la lumiere, col et carbo moyenne.
Des aromes un peu trop leger mais somme toute tres agreables sur les malts torrefies, le caramel. En bouche, on sent rapidement la chaleur des 11%, mais cela donne une belle rondeur a la biere. Des flaveurs de reglisse viennent sajouter a celles de grille.

Bottle at home 7th December 13. Starting to enjoy Christmas, this one has a strong liquorice and molasses aroma. Flavour is rich and smooth, quite complex, liquorice, molasses, some bittering hops on the finish. Nice one to sip by the fire.

(33 cl bottle from Brewberry with no front label just "Tsarina Esra Imperial Porter 2011 vintage" in handwriting; Bottled on 04/11/2011 according to back label) Pours black with frothy, creamy, tan head. Good retention and lace. Aroma is boozy with notes of roasted malt and dark bread as well as hints of molasses and oxydation. Full-bodied, soft carbonation, oily texture and a sweet and rounded finish. Flavour is figs and sweetness with a little bread. Quite a sipper.

Dark brown with a thin tan head. Nose includes dark fruit, toffee, roast, brown sugar. Flavor is a bit on the cloying side with notes of brown sugar, cocoa, coffee, and molasses. Moderate carbonation.

Bottle.
APPEARANCE: dark brown beer, small unstable beige head.
NOSE: burned malts, caramel.
TASTE: caramel, burned malts.
Disappointed...
Very nice, creme brulle, salt licorice and caramac candy bar. Really nice warming beer with a bitter hoppy finish that works really well with the overall tone of the beer.

11.2 ounce bottle poured into a brandy snifter. Pours a thick, viscous black with a thinner head of khaki colored foam. Decent retention. The aroma has notes of caramel, creme brulé, milk chocolate. Fairly sweet and chocolaty. Thick mouthfeel and body. Very subtle carbonation. Nearly chewy and syrupy. An earthy sweetness lingers after the swallow.

De Molen ci lascia sbigottiti davanti a un calice pieno di un liquido scuro e molto denso, quasi cremoso. Il grado scivola via, liberandoci da qualsiasi sensazione di pesantezza, obliato dalle note torrefatte e cioccolatose, chiuse da un finale luppolato indimenticabile. Con una sacher, con una crostata di mirtilli, da sola: questa birra lascia il segno nella memoria. Superlativa!

12 ounce bottle shared with kegbear, pours a dark dark brown almost black with zero head. Smells like sweet licorice. Good dark roasted malt mouthfeel with a bit of anise. Almost chocolatey finish. Very very delicious. Would buy again
user_location: The World of Beer, Texas, USA

text: Pours opaque black, slighty dark brown, very low carbonation. Thick light brown head that vanishes to around 5mm. Aroma : caramel,sugar, very nice. Taste is round with almost no bitterness. Palate is silky-smooth. A nice classic beer in the genre.

Bottle at FoCo Stout Tasting 2013, courtesy of Aaron. Thanks man! Pour is deep brown with a small tan head and decent lacing. Wet cardboard, bready, tangy, homebrew twang, oxidized mess in the aroma. Taste is Cooked vegetables, bready, wet cardboard, caramel, toffee, and bready. Light mouthfeel with soft carbonation. Bleh.

Pour out of 375 mL bottle, dark black pour with tan head, aroma brought notes of dark chocolate cardboard, hints of earth, coffee, slight earth, weird dark fruit. Taste is a mix of dark chocolate, dark fruit, hints of oak, vanilla, lots of cardboard, hints of earth. Ok.

Bottle @ Armins palace, ordered from craftShack recently. Pours a hazy reddish brown appearance with a light brown head. Cardboard, spicy grainy, caramel, light chocolate, super oxidized aroma. Goopy chocolate, vanilla, coconut, very oxidized flavor. Just ordered this and it tastes super fucken old.
Bottle. Deep dark pour with a white head. Amazing aroma of roasted malt and sweet chocolate and licorice. Moderate palate. Taste is dark fruit, semi-sweet. Great beer!

Presque noir avec un petit col le couleur de café. Larôme sucré de molasse, réglisse, un peu de chocolat, et un peu de fruits noir. Dabord le goût est un peu amer mais cest bientôt de molasse sucré puis de chocolat, réglisse, et prunes. Un bon après goût assez sucré. Un peu huileux en bouche, épais avec carbonation faible, cest aussi un peu vineux. Très bonne et aussi avec lalcool très bien caché.

rich aroma - coffee,vanilla, banana, chocolate, alcohol. Complex flavour; sweet with a touch of bitterness with pine notes - chocolate, caramel. Mouth feel is almost buttery. Somewhat hot. 
This is a very distinctive porter.

330ml bottle from Vinmonopolet. Pours a big light brown head which turns into a creamy upper layer. Medium lacing. Opaque dark brown body, almost black. Aroma is complex. I sense coffee, liquorice, dark chocolate, soy sauce, toffee and toasted bread. Quite sweet in the nose. Sharp and bitter on the tongue at first, then becomes sugar-like. The sweet aftertaste lasts a loooong time. Excellent palate, very creamy. Im not usually into porters, but this is one is fantastic!

couleur entre marron et noire, quasiment pas de mousse. Nez légèrement chocolaté, avec des raisins secs, de la prune, des fruits rouges. La texture en bouche est assez fluette, carbonatation faible, on trouve un peu de café, de chocolat, mais surtout beaucoup de fruits cuits (prunes, cerises, fraises), avec un côté vineux et aigre comme dans une Sour Ale (passage en fût ?). Les 11% ne se sentent pas du tout, les 93IBU non plus, cest très gourmand, à peine sucré, mais bien équilibré par le côté aigre et une belle acidité. Finale longue, aigre, acide, avec une petite pointe de cendres.
Poured from a bottle it is a dark brown with a tan head. The aroma is very Malty the taste is roasted coffee that is full bodied and lingers on the palate

From a 33 cl bottle shared in Avon NC. Pours a hazy cola brown with a tan head. Aroma of dark cherries and plums. Flavors of dark stone fruits and a touch of licorice and a hint of coffee. Medium to heavy mouthfeel. Moderate carbonations. Bitter finish.
De molen. Tsarina Esra. Imperial Porter. 11% Skum: meget kraftig skum som holder længe. Duft: syrlig, Kaffe, brændt malt. Smag: kaffe, røg, vanilje.stor mundfulde

Color caoba oscuro, con espuma beige densa. Aromas de fruta acida con tostados y chocolate. En boca entra suave y dulce, afrutada, ligeramente ácida con un final amargo poco predomitante. En el regusto la acidez se impone. En general, un trago muy recomendable, si bien a veces no parece una imperial porter.

12oz bottle (bottled 5/12) pours almost black into tulip with about 2 fingers of tan head. Nose is roasty, milk, coffee, raisin, boozy notes. Mouthfeel is rich, creamy, thick, oily, a little sticky on the end. Taste is dark bitter mocha, raisin, cream, coffee, chocolate notes, pecan. Finish is rich chocolate milk, bitter, nutty, coffee, syrup, some sweet dark fruit notes. Nice.

330 ml bottle @ home. October 27, 2013.
Beer from "Vinmonopolet Vika", Oslo.
Beer from a tulip glass
Black in color with a beige head and medium carbonation.
Aroma is roasted malt,coffee,dark fruits,brown/dark sugar,tar and alcohol.
Tastes roasted malt,a bit tar and some alcohol.Sweet and bitter finish.

very dark colour, moderate creamy beige head;aroma of chocolate, some coffee, herbal liqueur and maybe dried berries; taste starts with intensive sweetness of roasted sugar and chocolate and continued by bitterness of coffee and hops - great porter

Dunkelbraun/schwarz, beiger cremiger schaum, karamel, melasse, honig, kaffe im aroma, süsslicher antrunk, geschmack wie aroma, feinherber und ausgewogener abgang, geringe rezenz, wohltuender nachklang, leicht klebrig.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Tsarina Esra Imperial Porter served in a small snifter. 
Completely opaque body is covered by an excellent head. 
Aroma: rich, sweet and complex, with a load of dark fruits and other elements I could not untangle. 
Flavor: starts too sweet then turns more and more bitter -- way more change in this dimension than usual. 
Feel: Creamy smooth; very soft; alcohol is almost completely hidden. 
O: extraordinary. My admiration exceeded my enjoyment.
Bottle on Håndtverkerstuene. Almost black with beige head. Aroma of coffee, some alcohol. Taste of Alcohol, roasted malt, chocolate malt, some licorice. Fullbodied and tart finish. A nice nightcap
Bottle courtesy of Travlr, many thanks! Tasty strong coffee really comes through in this porter.

33 cl bottle @ home. Pours black with a lot of sediment and a tan head that leaves a little lacing. Aroma is chocolate, roasted malt, coffee, liquorice, and dark fruits. Flavour is much like the aroma.

Bottle at home, from the De Molen shop, 30/09/13.
Pours a very dark mahogony brown with a thin light tan head that dissipates edgeward then stays for the show.
Nose is lightly soured dark fruit, dark treacle toffee, roast malts, hint of coffee.
Taste comprises brown sugars, cocoa, light coffee notes, treacle toffee, molasses, brown sugars.
Medium to full in body, fine carbonation, mineral bite and brown sugars in the finish.
Decent enough Imperial Porter.

text: (bottle 28 /09-2013) Low brown, black color, light roasted aroma, roasted taste.

zwart met bruine kraag
aroma van chocolade, koffie, caramout, gebrande mouten
redelijk tot zwaar zoet, behoorlijk bitter, zeer sterk, matige gefruit, sterk gemout
1e indruk; heerlijk aroma, sterke koffie tonen, zacht romig, koffie, chocolade, mouten (gebrand en geroosterd). Dit bier heeft de pech dat ik zojuist de pannepot heb geproefd, en deze was toch veel beter, maar niettemin is dit ook een prima bier !

Bottle. Two year old. The colour is pitch black with a light brown, medium head. Nice sweetish aroma of dark chocolate, oak, leather, roasted malt and some ash and port. Very compact and complex. Lots of roasted malt in the flavour as well along with more dark chocolate. Powerful and roasted. Nice oak in the end. Rich and sticky mouth feel, and has a light bitterness. Fantastically complex in every drop.

Bottle from Brewery Creek in Vancouver. Pours deep dark brown with a tan head. Aroma of raisins/grapes, dark fruits, rum, and surprisingly little roasted anything. Taste is also dominated by these dark fruits, and is quite sweet; only slight roasty notes, and not many IBUs in the finish. Big and sticky body. Not what I espected from an "Imperial Porter", but delicious all the same.

Same problem as the guy below. Infected bottle. 
Purchased online @ Saveur Biere.com

Off-notes (Vinegar? Rotten apple skin?) in both aroma and taste. You still can tell it is supposed to be a damn good brew - it pours very dark brown with diabolically red tint (just awesome!) and theres a yummy cocoa note in the taste. But friggin sourness ruins all the experience...

And, damn, yes, it is not the first time it happens with De Molen bottles (always with the generic, black capped ones). 

Will be def. buying again. hoping for a better one.

Bottle from Cotteridge Wines; dark black pour with velvety beige head, balsamic vinegar aroma, Ive giving this an average score but this bottle was clearly infected its happened too many times now, clearly this brewer makes great beer Ive had them, but the QC is lacking.

Pitch black with a dark brown fast fading head. Noses strongly of clear vanish, ethanol, alcohol with some light sweet toffee notes and roasted malt notes to it. The texture is rather slick going into oilyness. Full bodied tasting bitter with notions of sweetness to it. Heavy beer! With a nice well balanced slick finish, lasting for some times. Very pleasant after a steak!
In de categorie van Rhythm & Blues. Wel wat bitterder en minder zoet. Werd uiteindelijk moeilijk om af te maken, bleef niet interessant genoeg.
Sweet and smoky. Oakey. Complex and balanced. Another home run from De Molen.

Pours a large rocky light brown mostly lasting head. Body is black, some sparkles are visible. 
Aroma contains moderate malts (dark bread, hay, molasses, roasted and burnt malts, coffee, dark chocolate), light hops (citrus fruits), light yeast (leather) and licorice, grape, raisin, cherry, cola and spices.
Flavor is light acidic, then sweet with bitter getting stronger to a light astringent finish.
Body is full with syrupy texture and soft carbonation.
Amazing balanced beer full of aromas and shifting flavors. Very good!

Bottle: Vintage 2007: #484/823: Served in a Chouffe glass:
Some beige bubbles that disappear wuick on top of a black colored beer.
Aromas of dog food, vinous, liquor, roasted barley malts, tar, sweets like marzepin and mocha.
Flavours of roast, red vinous notes, red wine barrel, wood, grainy roasted liquor, some coffee and chocolate, bitter tones, some yeast, light hint of spices, some light liquorice tones and raisin.
Aftertaste is bitter, roast, malts, light vinous, raisin and oatmeal/porridge.
No carbo, watery mouthfeel, medium to fuller body and watery texture.
Decent but past its prime. 3.7

Bottle:Vintage 2010: #893/1344: Served in a Chouffe glass:
Mediummti smaller beige to light brown ish foamy head on top of a black colored beer.
Aromas of raisin, soap, hops, flowers, oatmeal, liquor, manure, roasted barley malts, liquorice, tar and toffee.
Flavours of vinous notes, marzepin, barley malt roast, cream, raisin, some darker chocolate, bitters, some coal and roast, some yeast, oatmeal, roasted hay, a hint of coffee and a light soap touch.
Aftertaste is a mix of roast, barley malt roast, vinous, hay roast, some coffee, raisin and bitters.
Low carbo, soft creamy to silky mouthfeel, medium to full body and an oily texture.
This one is lot better than the 2007 version. Deeper, fresher and more anjoyable! 4.1

text: This poured a medium brown with a beige head. Aroma was of chocolate, smoke, and cola. Flavor was similar but more on the caramel and chocolate side, lacking and roast really and a bit too sweet for me.

Jet-black beer with a thin foam. Aromas ofroasty maltiness, strawberry and licorice. Moderate sweetness, chocolate and coffee. Very intense aroma and pleasant. 
Hints of sweet on taste to come up with milkchocolate with strawberries ​​flavors. Toasty, slightly licorice and coffee. Pretty good balance.
Full-bodied, palate. With even slightly burnt ashy at the end. 
Tsarina Esra Imperial Porter is great beer, which clearly needs maturing.

22nd November 2012All these years and not rated this! How did that happen? Opaque black - brown beer, a few tan bubbles for a head. Palate is smooth and semi dry and pretty much zero carbonation. Rich dark chocolate malt. Touch of dark fruits. Simple beer, and flat - but amazing!
brown, hazy, minimal head, soy sauce, cereal, grass, earthy, medium sweetness, lightly sour, medium body, oily feel, average carbonation, bitter,
brown, black, clear, brown foam, roasty, bread, nuts, full body, oily feel, average carbonation, heavy cloying sweetness, medium bitterness,
Bottle. Pours dark brown with a brown head. Aroma is heavy roast, chocolate, liquorice, nuts and some citrus. Taste is medium sweet and light bitter. Heavy body with soft carbonation.

Bottle from Asahiya. Big dark chocolate aroma, with some perfumey yeast and berries. Near pitch black, generous brown head. Sweetish chocolate initial; then the alc. hits in mid palate, with cherries, peat, and more chocolate, along with some bittering; a mild ashy thick finish and the final bitterness is restrained. Thin-medium body. Very pleasant and warming. Drink by 2036.... maybe too young. But very good, overall.

UPDATED: DEC 26, 2013 Bottled. 
Pretty head on black. Lots of umami, meaty nose. Burnt ash, lots of fruit in the mouth, prune, raisin. Tasty and meaty, with rich chocolate. nicely sweet and just a bit roasted. Wine-like character too. Great.
Aroma is chocolate and prune. Taste is prune, raisin and bitter chocolate. Great beer!

Small bottle. Pours dark brown to black in color with a medium sized beige head. The aroma is ample dark fruits, prune, raisin, roasted malt, chocolate, and earthy. The flavor is heavy with dark fruits, prune, raisins, some sweetness, chocolate, earthy, wood; sticks on the tongue a bit.
Pitch black with a tan head. Aroma is quite roasty, some chocolate and licorice, mostly roasted malt. Taste is sweet chocolate, roast malt, soy sauce, fruit, booze. Nice.

otra maravilla de este productor. de las 3 variedades de Tsarina que he probado, me quedo con la básica. sin pasar por barrica. 
Aroma de fruta madura, muy maltosa. torrefacta, seca. licor. sabor a la vez seco y aterciopelado. dulce y amargo a la vez. final licoroso y cálido. poca carbonatación. espuma cremosa y duradera. una cerveza única y inmejorable.

dark brown to black with creamy head.malty toasty head with strong alcohol tones,flavour is dry bitter dark chocolate with long bitter finish,firm bodied as you would expect from a beer of this strength,more of a stout than a porter and really good one

Black with off white foam. Aroma is light vegemite. Taste is roast, then strong sweetness. Nice, but not super complex. Overall, one of the best imperial porters Ive had, but wish it had a bit more going on.
Seriously. It doesnt get much better than this. This imperial porter is smooth, tasty and balanced like Philippe Petit. I would bath in this beer if I could.

Draft @ DeMolen. Dark brown with a beige head. Aroma of chocolate, coffee, roasted malt and vanilla. Flavor is rich chocolate, coffee and dark malt, faint alcohol. Medium to full body and very smooth. Great beer, rich and smooth.

mouthfeel: delicious. Creamy, round and full, but with a proper carbonation kick.

overall: Im tending to give this one a 5 actually. But usually i only get there after i had a few. This is the one id go back to the brewery for so far, after bringing back a whole case of "The Molen" bears last time as tasters. Its quite alcohol heavy, but you dont get none of that when drinking (after maybe ;)). It has such a great flavor balance. I like porters, but most of the time they are just a touch off balance. Its too bitter, too milky or whatever. This one seems to do everything right. Highly advised!

EDIT: got some new ones last week, but somehow seems to taste quite different this time. Maybe its because they need longer cellar time, but these werent nearly as good.

Poured a deep black with no head apparent. Aroma of dark chocolate and some citrus hops. Full, oily body. Flavour is dark chocolate, berry fruit and some liquorice.

bottle pours deep dark murky brown with ruby edges. No head what so ever. Nose has nice debittered chocolate and slight roast. Taste pretty much follows in order with adequate bitterness and addition of licorice. Light notes of citrus on finish. Body is full, very light carbonation.
Lost my notes on this one but here goes anyway. dark dark dark brown with no head. Very vinegary and sweet. Roasty and sticky sugary finish.

33 cl fles @home. een hele lekkere porter.

Bottle. Dark brown beer with a tan head. Rich malt and chocolate aroma with light licorice. Caramel and toffee flavor with chocolate. Medium bodied. Toffee and caramel lingers with chocolate and light licorice.

12 bottle.  Black pour with a quickly fading thinnish tan head.  Aroma is thin, dry roast with chocolate, bitter hops, and background raisin and darker malt. 2012-10-25. Black nice creamy brown head. 4+ Aroma is pleasant, fruit accented dusty lightly roasty malt. 8+ Flavour is richly delicious, sweet dark malt is velvety on the tongue, light alcohol and a tangy imperial porter fruit quality in the finish. Bottle at Volo, Toronto

Bottle with James, pours a murky mud color with beige medium head, very nice lacing. Aromas and taste of brown sugar, plum, citrus hops, toffee, roasted malts, chocolate and light licorice. Insanely hoppy and bitter for a porter. Medium body, more then average carbonation for the style. Palate is nice and sticky. One of the best imperial porters I have tried.

This one has a lovely aroma of cacao, roasted malts, dark chocolate, cinnamon, alcohol and hints of vanilla. Pours black with a small light brown head. T: Dark chocolate, heavy roasted malts, and burned espresso and some bitter piney hops towards he end. M: between medium and light with high/med carbonation. It has a bitter and roasty finish. O: its been a while since I had a de molen offering and its not because there bad is just for the price this goes for (11 bucks in the US) I have better options. This just had a harsh character that I didnt enjoy, it was to bitter for the style and heavly roasted. The bitter notes fade as it warms but the heavy roast remains.
light sweet brown sugar with roasted aroma,black, brown foam, light sweetness, medium bitterness, medium body, creamy, soft carbonation,nice soft roasted finish.

Aroma:  Intense chocolate flavor, thats the most noticeable aroma, sweetness of caramel, vanilla, some charcoal (as in all de molens), excellent aroma. Appearance:  A little lame like most de molen, the head and lacing are extremely limited, but the dark character looks nice.  Taste:  Lighter than I expected actually, sort of like an imperial stout light, aroma comes through in the taste, and theres a little bitterness at the end from the hops, nice but not blown away.  Palate:  Nice palate, smooth in the beginning and a little rough at the end from the hops, nice lasting lace in your mouth.  Overall:  Definitely the best porter Ive ever had, but it begins  to blur the line between styles a little.

Une bouteille offerte par Yan.  Encore une fois, un gros merci!  Un liquide  embouteillé en 2011.  Une robe qui est presque noire sur laquelle flotte une tête brune assez épaisse et bien résistante.  La naissance dune dentelle.  Un nez bien expressif de chocolat et de malts torréfiés qui se laissent tranquillement envahir par un alcool floral et des houblons qui me semblent apporter une touche épicée.  Quelques traces de cendre qui apparaissent ici et là, au fil de la dégustation.  Un goût très concentré sur les malts rôtis et torréfiés avec une présence de notes douces et de réglisse noire.  Un retour discret des notes cendrées.  Des houblons toujours au garde-à-vous et des notes fruitées qui proviennent de la levure et/ou des céréales maltées.  Une bouche très bien construite et satisfaisante avec son corps musclé.  Un apport de bulles qui colle au style et une texture huileuse à souhait.  Une finale qui combine lamertume des houblons avec celle des grains rôtis.  En conclusion, très appréciable.

Poured from a bottle into a snifter.

The beer itself is nearly black with a tightly wound tan froth that exists mostly as a cap on top of the beer.

The aroma is not that appealing.  Dark chocolate, molasses, and some bitter coffee notes provide the nice part of the aroma, but licorice and earthy hops are less interesting, and there is a metallic copper smell that hovers above everything else.

The flavor is slightly better.  There are no noticeable metallic notes in the flavor, leaving dark chocolate, roasted malt, smoke molasses to provide a nice front, with licorice and a moderate earthy hop finish.  The flavor is a bit strange as well, and it is not something I really enjoyed.

The beer feels fine on my palate.  It is full, rich, chewy, and smooth, with a medium carbonation for the style.  It is a little bit dry and smoky up front, and the earthy hops, coffee, and licorice, provide a kind of acrid, dry bitterness.

Overall this is not a beer I would really go after trying again.

Overall, very nice, very roasty and very coffe but, sadly, even very flat.
Very dark brown with a small brown head. Malty with fruity notes. Malt, licorice, fruit, coffee and chocolate. Full body with a long, bitter sweet finish.
small bottle, no head, aroma roasty chocolate. Color black no head. Taste heavy, medium bitter. Full body, like oily. Nice beer but more a RIS then a Porter.

Bottle. Black with gorgeous tan head. Creamy mouthfeel. Light carbonation. A sweet, mildly hoppy flavour. Theres a syrupy prune note. A smoky presence.  The alcohol is well contained. All in all, this beer is an absolute delight. So much going on.

Bottle. Pours black with a thin tan head. Aroma of liqourice, chocolate and booze. Flavour is dark chocolate, dark fruit with a hoppy bitterness in the background. Almost flat but full bodied. Very good.

Bottle.... It pours pitch black with a medium creamy tan head..... the aroma is fruits, roasted malts, vinous and chocolate.... the flavor is vinous, port wine, roasted malts, caramel, spices and yeast...

180mL bottle, sent from Glouglouburp (thanks Dany), pours black with a small tan ring of head. Aroma of sugar, slight brandy (though not as pronounced as in the Reserva version), liqueur-coated chocolate and a considerable hop presence. Flavour is rich and full-bodied with brandy covered fruits, chocolate, slight booze, wood, and finishes roasty and hoppy. Full-bodied and complex, especially for a porter. Inferior to the Reserva but still damn well-made and enjoyable.

Bottle at Dans. Pours a deep black/brown. Aroma of dark fruit, hop spiciness, liquor, a touch of chocolate. Chocolate, dark fruits, liqyorice and hop spice in the taste. Maybe a touch flat, but it suits this one. Very nice indeed.

Bottle at home. Black pour, tiny beige head fades to nothing. Possibly a little flat. Big fruity nose, liquorice, spicy hops. Definitely porter not stout. Rich chocolate front, fruity, slightly tangy with a bitter fruity finish. Lovely beer!

2010 bottle. Black with a small tan head. Roasted aroma with malt, liquorice and coffee. Flavour is roasted malt, bitter hops, some coffee and liquorice. Full-bodied, dry and bitter aftertaste. Good, quite balanced porter.

Brown, dark bodied with amazing bubbly and firm tan head. Rich, creamy aroma with roasted bread, chocolate covered toffee and pine tree. Great lacing. Very, very smooth body, even though the alcohol bursts though in your troat. Some sharp nasty bits in the taste but these bring a welcoming bitterness to the otherwise sweet balanced beer. Aftertaste stays seemingly forever. A heartwarming beer, this is. Rough and smooth at the same time. An attack to your Christmas spirit taste buts. Like. (33cl bottle)
Black pour. Medium-sized tan head that falls quickly and leaves a little bit of lacing. Notes of vanilla, roasted grains, and alcohol. Chocolate and vanilla tastes. Bitter. Nice beer.

18cl bottle pours an opaque, mahogany brown with a thin, creamy, slight off white head.  Aromas of ground dark chocolate, light smoke, almost like a slice of brown bread that spent two minutes too long in the toaster, malted milk balls, a little rubber, some dried pine.  Flavor is bitter, both from the hops and from burnt malts, rubbery, some light smoke, dried leaves, some cherry, a little espresso, mexican chocolate.  Full bodied, dry, slightly hot finish.

Bottle #0722 from Allen thanks a lot. A dark beer with low brownish head. Nose is caramel and chocolate like, hopy. Aroma is a creamy dark chocolate with an intense roasted and bitter licorice finish, molasse. Body is creamy with grassy, resin and metallic notes, some vinous notes too, alcohol is a bit burning, notes of prunes, pineapple almond and coconut notes. Intense aftertaste, very long hops bouquet and bitterness.

ANother gem shared by Tom. Thanks! Aroma is a touch musty and oxidized, basement, alcohol, dark fruit, a touch of smoke. Pours dark brown with no head aat all. Some smoke, dark fruit, roast, light soy. Lingering light roast in the finish. Not carbonated at all. Somewhat refined and clean, unobtrusive imperial porter in many regards. FInishes a little hot, but not over the top. GOod stuff.
Bottle 2011. Color very dark brown with small brown head. Aroma malt, roasted, coffee, strawberry praline, chocolate. Taste coffee, chocolate, roasted, caramel, praline.

2010 bottle 916/1344.
Black, cappuccino to light brown head.
Aroma: chocolate liqueur, vinous.
Taste: chocolate mousse, cocoa, licorice, black wine gums, wood, some ashes, roasted coffee beans, dry.
Full-bodied, liqueur-ish, low carbonation. 
Great, complex, but still well-balanced.

In short: A slightly chocolaty, grainy and roasted stout.  A typical example of the style.
How: Bottle 12oz.  I didnt not the bottling date, probably around two years of age.  Bottle sent to me by my buddy ygtbsm94, thanks a lot Brad
The look: Black body topped by a very short-lived beige head.
In long: Nose is plain big fat dark malts with moderate roastiness.  Taste is grainy burnt malts, cocoa powder, burnt black cake, some tar notes, old coffee filter.  Nothing fruity in this beer.  The carbonation was a bit too relaxed but thats probably because of the age of the beer.  I wanted to drink it side-by-side with a bottle of the Reserva version and I probably waited a bit too long.  Finish is surprisingly dry with the roastiness and coffee notes taking over.  Totally different from the Tsarina Esra Reserva version I had side-by-side.  The Tsarina really doesnt stand out in the sea of typical roasted big black beers, it is generic but nonetheless enjoyable.  Glad I was able to try it.  Not sold in North-American so I can thank the internet for this one, it is because of the internet that Ive heard about this beer and also because of the internet that Ive heard about all those newspapers going bankrupt.

Bottle from De Molen, Bodegraven, Holland, consumed 25.09.11   Pours very dark brown actually its probably black to all intents and purposes. I actually get some hoppiness on this one, but it is a heavy beer, roasty and with a lovely smoothness, some chocolate and a little praline and dried fruit. Good stuff.   A7 A3 T8 P5 Ov15  3.8
18cl bottle from amsterdam. red wax on the bottle. Pours a dark black. Similar to an imperial stout. lots chocolate in the aroma. and the taste. Very good taste.
Black body light brown head. Aroma of roasted malty candy, some chocolate. Flavour is really intense with ash, chocolate, coffee and lots of roasted malts.

Draught at De Molen, Bodegraven, the Netherlands. 
Pitch black colour with big fluffy tan head.
Chocolate, coffee, roasted malt and mild vanilla sweetness in aroma.
Strong coffee, roasted malt, chocolate sweetness and ash in flavour. Strong bitterness in aftertaste. Strongness takes the breath away.
Smaller green bottle with red wax. Poured dark brown with little tan head that retained. Very roasty malt upfront with a long roasty, bitter and alcoholic finish. Very interesting.

tiny bottle brought back by a couple of friends (thanks again guys). deep black pour with a little tan head. strong chocolate and coffee aroma. awesome roasty malt flavour mixed well with hops. love how the hops really came through in the finish. great beer!

Vintage bottled on 12/3/2009.  18 cl bottle # 1314.  The beer pours to a really dark cola colored body with a thin cola like head.  The aroma is huge on the sweet chocolate truffles, molasses, and prunes.  The flavor and palate is where this beer excels.  Very robust body thats thick but not at all sticky.  Deeply roasty malts overpower once you swallow the sweet chocolate and prunes concoction that is up front.  Theres a deep dry charcoal and woody type of flavor on the finish.  The palate is soft and super easy to drink.  Id have never guess so high an ABV the alcohol fermented so cleanly.

Kleine fles van 18cl. Erg donker bier met kleine maar dikke bruine schuimraag. Pittge moutige houtige smaak met bittere chocolade. Voelt erg vol en dik in de mond aan, bijna olie-achig. Weer een toppertje van "de Molen"!

Pours dark chocolate into a snifter. Mocha head with excellent retention recedes leaving spider lacing to coat surface. Dark pit fruit and chocolate aromas. Sweet chocolate and espresso upfront turning to dark caramel covered pit fruit.  Lasting espresso finish.

Bottle @ Home. # 32518cl  Pours black with small tan head. Aroma of roasted malt,  mild coffee, caramel, milk chocolate, bacon. Taste is hard roasted malt, coffee, milk chocolate, caramel, light smoke, raisins. Full body, low carabonation. 130811

Bottle 18cl from DeMolen biershop. Not sure same description, label has other hops as Challenger and Saaz and a 10%abv:
Bottle 709 of 1344.
Couleur brune foncée, mousse moka.
Arôme note de houblon et amertume citronnée, malt choco, qcq épices peut être réglisse et caramel.
En bouche, pointe de fruits noirs, palais est épais est chocolaté avec en retrait une touche damertume se mélangeant avec un café amer et choco noir.
Fini colle un peu sur les lèvres, note anise et réglisse. Les deux houblons rajoutent juste ce quil faut damertume qui garde ce profile tchèque tout en utilisant le Challenger qui donne une belle présence de houblon sans pour cela prendre le dessus avec une amertume trop élevée.
Dark brown pour.  Aroma is boozy, loads of dark sweet dried fruits and tobacco, chocolate.  Rich mouthfeel, flavor is deep and malty, boozy bread, light soy presence is pleasant.  Bold and flavorful.

Black pour with a tan head. Lots of roast and booze with sweet molasses sneaking in as well. The flavor holds cocoa nib, milk chocolate, bakers chocolate, cream, and earth. Uber thick palate with a hot finish.

#449 bottled nov 1, 2007.
dead flat pour. super dark and viscous rich porter shade of black.
the aroma is amazing...bourbon-like notes of spice, rich caramel, florals along with ash, chocolate, smoke and red grapes.
the flavor is the same but with a noted vinous tartness and tannic finish. it is sticky and wonderful yet really dry and chalky. roasty, smoky, ashy aftertaste is amazing. i dont care if it is flat... this is incredible!5+

Big thinks to oteyj for this bottle. Dark brown pour. Nose and flavor of caramel malt, dark fruit, some roast, and definite hot booze presence, but in a very good way. Not smooth but the alcohol is not aggressive on the palate.Nice.

from Erzbierschof - dark black beer with a little beige foam left; fairly roasted aroma of dark chocolate, prunes and licorice; thick and full-bodied, moderate carbonation and very oily; a strong bitterness with a long aftertaste of coffee, nuts and a solid presence of spices - just sit back and enjoy !

UPDATED: NOV 30, 2012 pours pitch black, with little to no head at all. 
when swallowed, a flavours of sweet and alcohol sticks to the lips and the inside of the mouth. 
medium to full body, with an oily texture
a rather good beer, but not the best from De Molen

Pour nicely looking dark brown/light black, with a small light tan slightly frothy head. Aroma of bitter meltet chocolate, vanilla, caramel, slight dark fruits, brown sugar. The taste is pretty sweet upfront, with a semi-dry n bitter finish. Re-rate of my first ever rating.

Bottle shared by Kyle, thanks! Poured a slightly hazy dark brown with a gray head that dissipated to the edges. Aroma started with roasted malts with some backing sweet dark grains and sweet chocolate. Flavor had strong roasted malts with sweet dark grains and a bit of bitter chocolate in the finish.
Pours black with a light brown head. Aroma is roasted malt and chocolate. Flavour is roasted malt, alcohol, chocolate, coffee and liquorish.

Small bottle of the 2010 vintage. Syrupy black with virtually no head. Aroma is of fruit and peat. Taste is smoky with hints of chocolate, licorice and coffee, with a slightly harsh bitter aftertaste. Not as impressive as I thought it would be.

Bottle nr 028.Pours dark brown with a beige head.Aroma of malt, yeast, spice, floral hops, citrus and cold coffee.Flavor is sweet and somewhat bitter with some floral,peach and orange .Medium to full body, soft carbonation.Really nice and hoppy stout.

Bottle 180ml @ Geokkjer
Pours black with a light tan head. Aroma has notes of roasted malt, coffee, pine and floral hops. Taste is medium to heavy sweet and medium bitter. Body is full, texture is oily, carbonation is flat.
Black with a small off-white head. Aroma of toffee, licorice and a bit of roasted malt. Sweet and mild roasted flavour with toffee and licorice. Quite hoppy and bitter.

Sampled at Copenhagen Beer Festival 2011. Pours a pitch black beer with a beige head. The aroma is malt, roasted, chocolate and licorice. The flavor is following the nose. The palate is sweetness. Overall a good beer.

18cl bottle #104 batch 19 Feb 09 (28 months old)
Pitch black color with a beige ring of foam arround the glass.
Rich heavy nose of roast, chocolate, plums, subtle hint of red fruit, slight touch of vanilla, alcohol presence. Full body, malty flavor, chocolate, dark fruit, alcohol touch, not a great finish, sticky palate.

Draught at Københavnske Øldage 2011.  Very black, small beige head. Sweaty hops blends with licorice and strawberry. Sweet and soft, full bodied. Lots of tobacco and licorice, spun sugar comes through before the bitterish finish.
Not really my style, but still it scored pretty high. Didnt like the mouthfeel.

Den har en mörk och ganska vinös, lite sötaktig doft.
Munkänslan är mycket torr, och det är en stark porter men som tyvärr inte riktigt har den stora
smaken som jag har känt i många andra porter och stout från De Molen.

Trevlig är den, men ingen jätte höjdare.
Bottle a black colored beer with a brown head aroma coffee fruits spicy roasted malts and chocolate flavor caramel coffee fruits spicy roasted malts chocolate and some bitter hops

Sampled @ Copenhagen Beer Festival 2011 from bottle. Pours a hazy murky-brown body lasting off-white head packed with lots of floaters. Sour and tarty aroma, oaky and light hopy with a hint of butter. Softly carbonated and medium-bodied. This was some strange flavors! Slightly sweet and sour, its hopy but almost pungent-hopy. Longlasting alcohol and hops in the aftertaste. Interesting, but a bit weird and definitely not what I was expecting from an imperial porter.
Black with a light brown head. Aroma is sweet, roasted malt, chocolate and alcohol. Flavor is quite sweet and moderate bitter. Dry and bitter finish. Smooth. 260511
Please aroma. Slightly sweet with hints of cherries, figs, and black currants. Smoky aftertaste. Caramel goodness.

180 ml bottle.
Pours a pitch black colour with a small, light brown head. Aroma of strong tobacco, roasted malts and chocolate. Flavour of roasted malts, tobacco, dark coffee and chocolate. Oily texture. Full bodied with a thick mouthfeel and a smooth, dry, roasty finish. Pleasant.

180ml bottle, thanks lusikka

Pours pitch black with a sticky head. Aroma has hints of roasted malts and tobacco. Taste is quite imperial stoutish without a massive amount of typical roastiness. Sticky, long lasting finish. Nice, but nothing special here.
Draught at Copenhagen Beer Festival 2011. Dark brown colour with a small beige head, Aroma and flavour of roasted malt, coffee, chocolate, alcohol and caramel.

Draught. Low fluffy brown quickly disappearing head. Pitch black body. Coffee choccolate creamy roasted malt caramel aroma and flavor with a subdued alcohol note. Low carbonation. Long aftertaste. Lovely

Süßlicher, stark malziger Antrunk. Ein getreidiges Aroma steht kurz alleine da, wird dann aber süß-würzig und wirkt mit der Malzigkeit ausgewogen. Vollmundig, Hopfen und Malz spielen gut miteinander. Dabei sehr süffig. Gut! /12/12/13//12

Bottle 4 years old. Dark brown color, small brown head. Aroma is buttery and thick with lots of smooth roast, coffee, chocolate and spices. Taste is quite sweet, also spicy with some oak, coffee and smooth liqourice. Maybe a little on the sweet side.
Tap. Very dark brown with medium beige head. Flavour is roasted malts, chocolate, coffee, little bitter, dark fruits and little liquorice.

Bottle 180 ml from erzbierschof. Opaque black with short brown foam. Aromas of big roasted malt, fig, tobacco, dust, mushrooms and wet wood. The taste is similar, complex, coffee, licorice, vanilla, raisin, alcohol, hints of smoke and wood. Thick, sticky, that a little reminds a cough mixture.

Bottle. Tan head, and purely dark brown.  Fair amount of hops in the aroma, grapefruit, wood, and roasty maltiness. Earthy flavors, dark roasted malt and a bit of smoke and dark fruits.  Warming, viscous and oily.  Solid.

Bottle shared by Nickls.  Pours black with a medium, fizzy tan head, medium retention with good lacing.  Aroma is heavy malt (nutty, roast, toast, biscuit), average hops (grassy, herbal), and average esters (fruity) with notes of earth, mushrooms, and prunes.  Flavor is  heavy malt (nutty, roast, toast, biscuit), average hops (grassy, herbal), and average esters (fruity) with notes of earth, mushrooms, coffee, and prunes.  Full body, medium warmth and carbonation with a dry finish.  Very earthy beer.

UPDATED: JUL 14, 2011 180mL red wax 2010 ed bottle #555 with a big thanks to nickls for sharing! What a treat. Tsarina Esra pours a tepid to flat muddy brown with heavy opacity. Not super enticing. The aroma is very interesting: orange dark chocolate, potpourri, heavy clove and dried citrus peel, mild cognac/Grand Marnier, spiced rum, orange liquor. Taste is soft, spicy, dark chocolate bitter, big orange spice and cognac. Palate is rich, soft, oily, full. Would like some more! 5/9/2011 8/3/7/4/15=3.7180mL 2009 ed bottle. The pour is a tawny deep ruby with a thick, brown head erupting (almost impossible to pour a bottle this small and generate a head- but it can be done). Sticky lace. Nose is red licorice but opens up into cinnamon and fudge. Taste is silky, milk chocolate, heavy fudge and brownies. Very rich and silky palate. 7/13/2011 8/4/7/5/15=3.9

Bottle shared by Svend, consumed at 4 years of age. Pours deep, deep opaque brown, nice light brown head. Aroma has brown sugar, chocolate, fudge, caramel, sherry-like, hints of figs, dates and coffee. Taste has brown sugar, toffee, chocolate, sherry notes, figs, dates, coffee and roast, very sweet. Could use a bit more hoppiness to balance some of the sweetness. But really nice aside from that.

Bottled. Pitch black coloured. Small quite fluffy light brown head. Aroma of liqourice, roast, caramel some vanilla. Flavour of roast, liqourice, caramel, herbs, some flowers, spice and then some. Medium to full bodied. Has a roasty and spiced bitterness in the end. Smooth alcoholbite on lips and palate. Very good.
7oz nub bottle, pours black without a head. Rich roasty aroma, coffee. Very rich SIP, very roasty, warming inside. Slightly earthy. Sweet chocolate comes out as the glass warms. Very nice.

4/15/11. 18cL bottle courtesy mlunger12! Cloudy, not quite opaque black pour with creamy edges and a small ring of tan head that fades to nothing almost instantly. Alcohol on the aroma with plenty of ash and roasted malt and coffee in the background. Much nicer flavor of sweet chocolate, ash, big roasted malts, and lingering coffee. Alcohol is hidden well in the flavor, but not in the aroma. Very nice flavor!

Bottle 0,18l from Bierkompass. Dark brown color with almost no beige head. Aroma strongly fruity, caramel, vanilla, licorice. Taste, dark fruit, caramel, chocolate, coffee, vanilla. Nice long coffee like bitter finish. Alcohol is strongly present.  Nice bee. Id like to have bigger bottle of this.

18cl bottle poured into a tulip, bottle # 1167...Pours a dark brown with a light tan had, rises about two fingers, but gone right away. Spotty lacing...A very strong aroma of alcohol, black licorice, but it sweet, yet Im not thrilled...The taste pulls this out, super complexity. There is still lots of alcohol, this could use some time before drinking. The taste is very vinous, I would assume this was aged in red wine barrels but I cant find anything to indicate that. A sweet start, red wine, then a bitter coffee finish. A very tannic feel. Enjoyable to drink, but this is a sipper.

Worth trying.

Dark brown, not much head. Aroma of coffee, salmiac, some vanilla, medicinal schnapps and fireplace. Very slippery mouthfeel. Taste is vanilla, coffee and more medicinal herbs. Licorice is there too. I can definitely feel the saaz in this one.

Bottled 18cl. Bottle number 1189. Small, beautiful creamy deep beige head. Tar, wild strawberries, spicy and citrusy hops, molasses, pink grapefruit marmelade, pineapple, coffee and dark chocolate show up in the nose. Deeply complex and inviting nose. Full bodied. Syrupy. Suprisingly salty. Beautiful hop profile. Tar, molasses and pineapple are rather present in the taste. Strong bitterness. Very low carbonation. Warming on the swallow. Nice lacework. Licorice, pineapple and pine needles in the finish which is dryish. The saaz hop really adds to my appreciation of this beer. A brew with a huge amount of character.

UPDATED: FEB 24, 2015 Pours black with a brown head. Aroma of hops, roasted coffee, dark dried fruits, tobacco and some spice. Taste is also hoppy with coffee beans, more spice, herbs, dark dried fruits and a bitter roasted finish.

330 ml bottle from VikingHammer- thanks, Brad! 2007 vintage. Pours a dark, oily, opaque brown color with almost no head whatsoever. Aroma of chocolate, coffee, dark fruits, earth, roasted malts, and wood. The flavor emerges more so than the nose (could have been because we were tasting a ton of things at a bar), with rich chocolate, coffee, roasted malts, tannins, figs, herbs, earth, and olives. So rich. Medium-full bodied, with low carbonation and a smooth mouthfeel that comes out fruity, sweet, and rich. Damn fine imperial porter.

Bottle 18 cl. Brewed on November 17 and bottled on December 17 2010. My bottle states the alcohol % is 10 and the beer has 92 IBU. So this brew seems to be different from the first Tsarina Esra. The beer is dark brown with a minimal tan head and an aroma of roasted malts, fresh hops, chocolate, mocca and dried prunes. The taste is really impressive, high on roasted malts and not too sweet, with notes of coffee, dark chocolate, caramel and maybe even something like cigar-smoke. The aftertaste is a very pleasant combination of roastiness and bitterness, that stays on your tongue for a pretty long time. This is a very nice brew and the only thing I still wish for is that the bottle was a bit bigger.

Bottle courtesy of my secret santa -- huge thanks!  Shared in a vertical with Reserva.  Pours an oily black color with no discernible head.  Surprisingly flat in body, but absolutely cavernous in flavor.  Brimming with notes of dates, plums, ash, red grape skins, tobacco, tannins, and apple seeds.  An amazing beer.
Deep brown pour with zero head. Booze, raisins, chocolate and roast in the aroma.  Flavor is roasty, tannic, and crazy good!  Simply awesome!

Aroma: Roasted malts, coffee, brown sugar and vanille. 
Appearance: Deep brown, with creamy soft foam. 
Taste: Roasted malts, chocolate, honey, spicy and coffe. 
Palate: Medium body. 
Overall: Best Stout 19/20.
UPDATED: MAY 14, 2012 An aged 75cl bottle, originally bought from De Molen.  Reddish/Dark with little head and an aroma of fudge.  Beautiful sweet fudge taste, one of the best beers Ive ever had.

An aged 75cl bottle with friends.
Lovely flavour. Dark colour. A great beer
bottle thanks to bu11zeye.  poured black with no head.  aroma was dark roast, dark fruits, brown sugar, and smoke.  flavor was much the same plus the alcohol.  medium body with no carbonation.

Bottle at Cardinal, Stavanger. Pours pitch black with no head at all. Strong roasted malts and coffee aroma, even slightly vanilla.Taste is not as complex as the aroma suggest, but still lots of hard roasted malts, coffee, liquorice and some alcoholic presence. Ends dry and hoppy. Oily and sticky mouthfeel

18 cl bottle. As I pour it it looks oily, very dark reddish brown. The head is dark and thin, very similar to the cream layer of a good espresso, and it fades quickly. The aroma seems infinite, with chocolate, raisins, coffee, warm alcohol (rum?), anise, smoke, dough, and more. Taste is very bitter, very sweet, but well balanced. One of the best beers I have ever had.

25 cl bottle at Cardinal 23.09.2010. 
Pours black with no head. Liquid is clear ruby red on the edges of the glass.
Fantastic dark dried fruits aroma all porty with an alco whiff. 
Sweet, alcoholic with a well balanced bitterness and dades, raisins and other dark dried fruits coming through. Complex and improving even more with a rising temperature. Full bodied and oily in texture this beer had me "Mmmm.."-ing every sip. Smooth and flat.

Tiny-ass bottle thanks to alfrantzell.  Pours darkest brown with a small tan head that fades to a ring and an interesting central circle.  Very nice aroma - roast, chocolate, anise, tobacco, mint, and spice.  Nice sweet caramel and chocolate malt on the flavor.  Fairly complex but subtle.  Anise, spices, herbal notes, tobacco, charry smoke, and even a slight Belgian yeast note.  Medium-bodied for the style with low carbonation.  Lighter-feeling than your typical imperial stout - maybe thats why its called an imperial porter. Just a little boozy.  Really nice overall.  Subtle but excellent.

(Bottle, Café Arendsnest, Amsterdam, 2 Aug 2010) Black colour with brief, pale brown head. Roasted, malty nose with black coffee, dark chocolate and liquorice. Malty, roasted taste with notes of strong black coffee, dark fruit, chocolate, liquorice and lots of citrussy hops in the finish. Full body, fairly sweet. Lots of citric hops make it quite bitter, but its brilliantly balanced with all the malt, coffee and chocolate. Complex, balanced and seriously impressive. One to savour slowly. Lovely beer!

Dak with the hook-up  thanks man!  Pours pitch black with a thin tan head.  The nose is burnt malt, dark fruit, tar, chocolate and booze.  The taste is asphalt, dark chocolate, burnt caramel, coffee and tobacco.  Medium fairly flat mouthfeel.  Nice beer.

Bottle generously shared by Dak...thanks big time for this one!!!  Have wanted to try this beer for ages.  Dark mahogany bordering ebony with barely a wisp for a head.  Aroma of dark fruit, cocoa, molasses, and burnt caramel.  Flavor is just a bit off.  Loads of raisin, licorice, soy, roasted malt, chocolate, and maybe even a light citrus touch.  Medium mouthfeel.  Good but not great.

(33cl bottle)  Pours a dark brown body with a spare tan head.  Aroma of wood, roasted malt, smoke, anise, raisins, chocolate, and vinous.  Flavor of caramel, ash, roasted malt, smoke, anise, and wood with a dry finish.

Bottle @ Nederlands Biercafe t Arendsnest, Amsterdam. What a cute little waxed bottle this is, cant be more than 2 deciliters at best. :-) Pours a pitch black body with a nice, creamy caramel top. Aroma is licorice, booze and hints of leather. The rich, velvety palate also reveals dark chocolate, hints of coffee and cough syrup. Dry and bitter aroma hops throughout the finish. Complex and sophisticated, this is one Im sure the Tsarina wouldve appreciated. It is also my rating no. 500, so in celebration of being halfway to a thousand ratings I say to you, my fellow beer lover: cheers! ;-)

Bottle. Pours a black color with a small tan head. Has a fruity vinous dark fruit aroma. Slightly roasted malty dark fruit and chocolate flavor. Has a fruity malty dark fruit and chocolate finish with a bitter aftertaste.
Dark black beer with no carbonation and no head. Strong, syrupy aroma of chocolate. Deep oaky flavour with a bitter after taste. Warming sensation, and a flavour that sticks around. Bloody good drop.
brown, barely any head. Boozy, raisins, chocolate. Both in the flavor and aroma.

180ml, brewed January 14, 2009 and bottled on December 3, 2009, #1284 of 1320 for this batch.  Consumed in August 2010.  Pouring virtually black and glossy at first glance, a backlight reveals a slight copperish sheen at the far edges.  A small outer ring of fat, clear bubbles outlined in brown is all that shows at the head.  Leaving behind a slight brown stain, a dense wash creeps down the glass, but leaves no lacing.  The nose indicates darkly roasted grain and concentrated chocolate syrup, with deeper reflections of burnt caramel, stewed raisins, molasses, and aged figs.  Theres a good amount of earthen hoppiness in there as well.  Flavors follow suit, again quite rich with dark chocolate, caramel, and molasses notes, yet sufficiently rounded out with burnt grain roast, bitter, earthen hops, and even a touch of espresso that emerges on the finish.  Lightly carbonated and slick, the palate sports ample heft, but some alcoholic heat seems to thin it out a bit, keeping it from being overly syrupy.  Damn good brew.  No doubt about it, De Molen knows how to make a mean dark ale.

Bottle. Pours a very dark brown. No carbonation and no head what so ever. Aroma wise this beer is brillaint. Lots of coffee, milk chocolate and vanilla. A little alcohol as it warms. Super smooth. Really good. Flavours are initially very sweet with dark caramel, treacle and dark chocolate. Finish is quite bitter thanks to hops and roasted malt. Mouthfeel is thick and oily. Great beer

180ml bottle, 15C. Put it into a 750ml brandy balloon just to be silly. Dark brown with a score of bubbles at the rim. Gently swelling aroma has dark roasted malt, prunes, cherries, vanilla, coffee, licorice, a little alcohol. Oily mouthfeel with the barest hint of carbonation. Tastes of what it smells. Theres sweetness but its just balanced by the hop and (pretty mild) roasted bitterness. A little tar at the end too. Comes across to me as a classed-up and mellow Baltic Porter. Harmonious.

24-JUL-2010, bottle @home, from Morten.
Black high viscousity fluid with almost no head.
Nose is strongly roasted and also slightly alcoholic.
Huge body with long aftertaste of hard roasted malts. Lots of  hops add to long finish.. Fine brew - world class.

Well, I finaly get to try an old friend again, and this time I can actually rate it. This is a small 18cl bottle bottle 0591 of 1320 bottled 14th Jan 2009. So its got a good 18months of bottle age to it. Pours out nice and oily coating the glass like a slick as it goes, then suddenly, like the H%V 666 a tight mocha head pops up out of nowhere to create what can only be described as, a perfect picture of a beer. Solid black body with brown/red hues at the edge of the glass and a dense tan/beige-brown head satnding a finger high - great conditioning. The first aroma that hits me, oddly enough, is Cointreau - it has without a doubt an orange liqueur aroma to it, brandy, orange and chocolate. Its a strange attack of bitter and tart notes. Behind this lies barley, toasted malt, chocolate, coffee and rustique mellow yeast/bread branyard characteristics. The Flavour is spot on for me. Simply put, it is impecabely well balanced - it verges on being too good to be true, totaly poised from first sip to finish. First up is more of this crazy chocolate orange, folowed by great fruity hops, then theres some good mineral notes in the midal, which turn quickly to earth. Also in the mids, there is a curious, but very pleasant fleating lager element, probably created by the aromatics pf the Saaz hops, and a light caramel malt flavour that wafts around. Finish has an element of smokiness to it, seems at first to be a little abrupt, but then a subtle finish continues on with superb length ad growing intesity. All the way through this beer displays elegance and melowness in abundance, which is neatley balnced by a curious fruit tartness which creeps in from time to time to add balance and keep the beer from ever getting to cloying. De Molen make the best stouts in the world.

Bottle number 646, November 2007 Bottle Date; Sampled February 2010
The beer pours pretty much visually flat, though it does muster a large bubbled ring of froth around the edges.  The beer is a tar black / concentrated brown color that is pretty darn opaque when held up to the light.  The nose smells of umami laden rich malt, hints of teraki, savory roasted grain, a touch of peanuts, toasted hazelnuts, toasted whole grain bread crust, espresso accented dark chocolate.  The finish sees a bit of alcohol warming that evokes thoughts of Bourbon.  Oxidation definitely is playing a rounding role here in the aroma, but it seems to only be contributing in positive ways up to this point.  It is really interesting how nutty the aroma is, this mixes quite well with the rich malt and roast grain notes.

My first sip sees me noticing that the beer is sweet, viscous, yet somehow thin due to the lack of carbonation.  This also has a touch of weird, almost rubbery, burnt vegetal note to the finish that is a bit distracting in my first sip.  Flavors of molasses, dark chocolate, and burnt brown sugar up front are followed by interesting leather notes, touches of tar, a bitterness from both burnt grain and hops.  In the far finish there is a touch of chalkiness, but the bitter roast grain husk flavors linger on the tongue without being overly astringent.  Some oxidation adds some burnt sherry notes, a background richness and roundness to the malt as well as a subtle nuttiness to the finish that in combination with some of the chocolate flavors makes me think a little bit of nutella (but without the aggressive hazelnut flavor).  Despite the light body (much of which is likely due to the lack of carbonation), this is most definitely a sipping brew and somehow it also has a thickness to it

An interesting beer that I could wish had a touch of light carbonation, but really still drinks pretty well without it.  I am not sure if this will actually make 25 years, but it has lasted the past two pretty well.
